Atari.Ru - http://atari.ru/nauchnye-roboty-muribot-uchebnyj-komplekt-dlya-postroeniya-robotov/
Robotics.com.ua - http://robotics.com.ua/news/research_robots/4517-muribot_training_package_for_building_robots
Here's what some people are saying about Muribot:
"I wish I could've studied robotics with this in school! I hope kids get this opportunity!"
"I am fascinated with automation, so to see your project in action, was a thrill. I am going to have to count my pennies to get me one of these."
"This is a really awesome project. I can only imagine the planning that went into the design of the circuit board alone."
The Story
"Electronics for Everyone!"
Most other educational platforms on the market today are either extremely expensive, or lacking in features. We saw plenty of solutions that were affordable, but lacked the functionality to grow with the user. We wondered: Can we create an easy to use, low-cost platform that was also full featured and would grow WITH the user? 
Meet Muribot
Meet the Muribot Robotic Educational Platform
Our dream is to create an affordableopen-source STEM platform that grows with the skill level of the individual using it. Something that is as useful to an elementary school student as it is to a university student, enabling people of all ages to explore those fields more freely than ever without having to spend a lot of money to do it.
To bring our dream to reality, we created Muribot. A $250 dollar robotic platform, that is nearly as cheap as a Mindstorms NXT, but with features comparable to one you might use at a university lab. We've packed this platform with an amazing set of features and functionality:
8x Infrared Proximity Detectors
8x Ambient Light Detectors
2x Quadrature Wheel Encoders
2x Line Detectors
3-Axis Accelerometer
Yaw Rate Gyroscope
3-Axis Magnetometer
Infrared Transceiver
1MB On-board Memory
~6-8 Hours Battery Life
Replaceable 900mAh Lithium Polymer battery
Charging and Programming via USB
I2C Extension bus to add your own sensors and hardware!
1 Year Warranty - If it break, we'll fix it!
The Muribot Mainboard with IR Proximity/Ambient Light Sensors
ARM/Raspberry PI/Arduino Compatible!
By installing the I2C slave firmware ANY third party hardware that has I2C capabilities can take control of the Muribot! All the sensors are on the same exposed I2C bus, so your hardware will have access to ALL of the platforms sensing capabilities! And with our 3D printable mounting bracket, you can make sure you get a secure fit to our platform.
With Muribot, you're only restricted by your imagination!!
As part of building and designing Muribot, I've spent the last two years and nearly $5,000 of my own money towards refining the design, packing more features into a less expensive platform until I had the low-cost high-quality product you see here today.
Who can use Muribot
Muribot is for students, hobbyists, and researchers. It was designed for people of all ages to explore STEM concepts and learn about robotics and coding. When you buy a Muribot, you get something comparable to a $4,000 platform.
Muribot is a great resource for teachers and educators, and is the perfect complement to any Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) curriculum. Muribot can be used to explore basic concepts such as:
Obstacle Avoidance
Maze Solving
Line Following
Follow/Avoid light
Shape Drawing
Odometry
Serial Communication
And some more advanced concepts:
PID Control Loops
Room Mapping/Path-finding
Signal Filtering
Sensor Fusion
Fuzzy Logic
Neural Networks
Swarm Robotics
How is Muribot different?
Muribot is different from other educational robotic platforms due to it being a university level platform that's designed to grow with the individual. The included API allows inexperienced users to easily explore robotics concepts without the complexity of learning how to use an embedded platform. A more experienced user could opt to control the hardware directly and forgo the library altogether.
Lightweight, Durable, and Compact package
With the only additional hardware being a USB cable the small size makes Muribot easy to transport and the hard outer casing means Muribot can survive and accident or two. Our cases will be printed on a Form1+ printer and will be very ABS-like in terms of durability.
Easy to Program
Cross-Platform, Open-source and Hacker friendly
We are built on the shoulders of open source giants, so it would only make sense to make our hard work open source as well. MuriProg is written in C using Qt making it easy to compile for Linux or Mac; you just plug-in, install, and start programming no matter what OS you have!
We designed the Muribot be user repairable and to use as many common and readily available components as possible, as well as making it easy to access our I2C bus and 3.3V line without having to modify the mainboard itself at all.
Why We Need You!
If you support our project, it will help us to truly bring Muribot to life and to the world. We will be able to purchase the equipment and enough supplies necessary to create them quickly, efficiently, and easily; as well as spend more time focusing on getting Muribot out into the world in general. We believe in the open source movement, and if we're successfully funded we'll be releasing all the files to create a Muribot online, for anyone to use to build their own Muribot.
By supporting us, you keep control of the company away from a bunch of greedy investors, who may or may not understand our dream and vision as well as we do.
Facebook! - http://www.facebook.com/moarobotics/
Twitter! - http://www.twitter.com/moarobotics/
Of course, the best way you can help us is by getting the word out! Sharing our project on Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media is really the greatest thing you could do to help with this and future projects. AND we will be forever grateful for your assistance in spreading the word.
How will the funds be used?
One thing we feel strong about is being open with you, the backers. A lot of Kickstarters do not disclose how they are going to use the funding they receive. We've done a lot of research into successful and failed Kickstarters to determine exactly how we should go about planning it, and pitfalls we should avoid.
Equipment and Supplies
Currently the thing we are in the greatest need of right now is a couple Form1+ printers. We priced injection mold tooling for the Muribot case. Tooling costs $8,000-$17,000 dollars, and when compared to the cost of a new Form1+ ($3,300) it's easy to see which way to go. The Form1+ is simply superior in price, and it can print complex and thin parts which we require not only for Muribot but for other products we're designing.
Another big factor is simply the fact that to facilitate the mold tooling would require us asking for nearly $20,000 dollars more. We're not greedy and we simply couldn't risk spending any funding on what could become a $17k paperweight.
If we're going to be building and shipping these robots we'll also need lots of supplies, things for shipping like boxes and packing materials; Electronic components such as PCB boards, resistors, sensors, etc.; and miscellaneous supplies like product manuals and USB cables.
The Form1+ uses a UV resin that isn't cheap and will make up a bulk of our ongoing production costs, as well as other supplies to facilitate the printing process. There may also be maintenance costs for these machines, as they will be doing a lot of work.
Backer Fulfillment
Kickstarter Rewards @ a Glance
 The most important thing for you that we will be spending money on will be fulfilling backer rewards so if you support us at bronze or above you actually get what you wanted. Based on our research and from our own projection, we've found that about 75% of the funding we receive will be used to build Muribots for our backers. This was expected, and our funding goal matches that expectation.
I've spent a lot of my own time and money refining the process to be as low-cost as possible, so that I can give you our assurance that if you support Muribot you WILL get your reward as promised.
Delivery Time-line
Delivery will be divided up into four distinct phases: Funding, Purchasing and Receiving Supplies, Assembly and Testing, Packaging and Shipping. Each of these phases are discussed in more detail in Risks and Challenges.
Funding – ~1 Month
Purchasing and Receive Supplies - ~2-4 Months
Assembly and Testing – ~4-8 Months
Packaging and Shipping – ~1-2 Months
Based on the above numbers, a tentative estimate to delivery completion would be 8-15 months. We feel this is a nice safe number that will give us breathing room; in the end if we finish ahead of schedule that's all the better.
Technical Specifications
Muribot Technical Specifications
 About Mid-Ohio Area Robotics
Our philosophy here at MOAR is “Electronics for Everyone!”- We believe an educational robot could be an amazing tool to spread interest in the programming, electronics, science, technology, engineering, and mathematics fields. We have designed Muribot with parents, educators, kids, robot enthusiasts, and researchers in mind. We hope that Muribot will lower the barrier into those fields and cultivate a whole new generation of scientists, programmers, and engineers.
About Michael Stone
Michael Stone, CEO/President of MOAR
 Michael Stone is Founder, CEO and President at Mid-Ohio Area Robotics where he designs affordable educational and hobby electronics for people of all ages. He creates unique modules and platforms that make it easy to explore science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM).  
Before founding MOARobotics, Michael has spent nearly a decade in a variety of electronics manufacturing and production environments for several Fortune 100 companies. Bridging multiple disciplines he now designs and produces low-cost electronics solutions .
His passion for robots started in his childhood and has stayed with him ever since. He embraces and embodies the FOSS (Free and Open Source Software) and Open Education movements and works actively to contribute to those areas.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The team behind Mid-Ohio Area Robotics has more than 5 years of industry experience manufacturing and fulfilling large quantities of consumer electronics products. We have our own in-house assembly equipment and have a lot of experience with the bugs and gremlins that can sneak into any well thought out plan. We have sent our products around the world, and thus we already have solutions in place for shipping.

When designing Muribot, we have been very careful to only use parts that are readily available in large quantities with short or no lead time. At the time of this writing, there is enough stock available in the US to make hundreds of Muribots, and all critical components are purchased from reliable sources inside the US. It is quite unlikely that any part will require a lead time, but it is a remote possibility nonetheless.

We have our printed circuit boards manufactured in China and have long standing relationships with several companies specializing in circuit boards. There is a chance that parts sourced from overseas could be lost, damaged, or otherwise unusable. This would add some additional time and cost, if we had to order some parts a second time. This is unlikely, but a risk worth mentioning.

A fulfillment delay could result if demand for Muribot exceeds our capacity to assemble them in-house. If that were to occur, we have relationships with a few manufacturers here in the US that could pick up the work load should a significant problem arise. Typically these companies have a lead time anywhere from five to eight weeks; therefore a two month turnaround time is the longest delay we could imagine occurring if we had to shift to one of these manufacturers. Again this is unlikely, but worth mentioning.

Check your posture right now. 
How is your back? And your neck? Probably not too great. Or you’re already in so much pain that someone sent you here (hugs). BetterBack allows you to effortlessly sit in perfect posture, easing back pain.
Highlights
BetterBack makes every chair ergonomic – Instead of spending hundreds of dollars on one chair, you can make every chair ergonomic. Lightweight and portable, you can throw BetterBack in your purse or backpack.
Next gen back support –  The keystone to good posture is the pelvis. Traditional back supports only focus on your lumbar spine. BetterBack stabilizes your pelvis, restoring your spine's natural curvature, and provides lumbar support. 
15 minutes a day – Like dumbbells at a gym, BetterBack helps you build up your posture muscles. Wear it for as little as 15 minutes a day to achieve great posture when you stand or sit on your own.
                                      BetterBack allows you to effortlessly sit in perfect posture, easing back pain. Even if you don’t have back pain, wearing it for just 15 minutes a day can retrain your default posture, so when you stand or sit without BetterBack, your posture is greatly improved. Good posture boosts your mood, confidence, motivation and overall health. 
Take a few seconds to re-posture yourself right now. If you’re sitting, chances are your back isn’t touching your chair at all. That’s because most chairs aren’t ergonomic, and many actually encourage bad posture. BetterBack makes every chair ergonomic. Sit effortlessly in perfect posture at your desk. Or on a plane. Or at a game. You get the idea.
You get fast results and long term comfort. Put BetterBack on in 5 seconds flat!
                                    Sit in perfect posture for minutes or hours. We took sizing into account from the 1 percentile woman all the way up to the 99 percentile man, so BetterBack can be adjusted to fit just about every body.
Imagine going to 50 of the best doctors, therapists and trainers around the world and asking them for their #1 posture tip. Well we did, and we put them together into an eBook for you.
Or get the Better Posture eBook FOR FREE!
If you’re not in a place to financially contribute to our campaign, we still care about your posture and your health! Simply share our Kickstarter page with your friends on Facebook or Twitter and we’ll give you the full copy of Better Posture for free. Just click on one of the share buttons below then enter your email where you’d like to receive the book here: http://bit.ly/1DHsTSq
                                                                                            You'll get every version of BetterBack ever made! Be the first to try them during prototyping and the first to own them after production. Plus, grab a flight to San Francisco and we'll get you set up with a custom training program, including three personalized workouts with Vint. We'll also roll out the red carpet for you and a friend to enjoy a chef-prepared dinner at my apartment with the amazing people who helped bring this project to life. Ask us anything!
Shipping
When you back this project, you’ll see shipping prices for your home country. We are based in the United States, but will be fulfilling orders from the US, Canada, EU and Hong Kong. Please note that if you live outside of those regions, you may be responsible for local duties, fees and taxes.
A few years ago, in the lovely year of 2012, I was the co-founder of a startup, Everest, that was building technology to help people live their dreams and achieve personal goals. I was mostly in front of a computer 12+ hours a day, but we also put on the Dream Series, which were meaningful events to help kickstart people's dreams. A few hours after an amazing obstacle course run through Golden Gate Park, my sciatica pain began. The pain and discomfort made it hard to concentrate, do great work and enjoy life.
Post-race wearing the trophy (the Golden Shoes) a few hours before sciatica pain would forever change my life. #NotWorthIt
I tried dozens of products, therapies and techniques to help with my back pain. Many of them had great features, but weren't full solutions for me. The Neo G Posture Brace: helped with alignment, but it was difficult to breathe and really bulky under my clothes; Easy Posture Lumbar Support: I still managed to wiggle and slump in my chair, and it only helped when I sat at my desk; the Nada Chair: brilliant knee form and pelvic stabilization, but gave me knee pain after just a few minutes of wear; LF Ultrasound: provided short-term pain relief, but it was fleeting; Memory Foam Knee Pillow: provided better alignment when I started sleep, but would end up in the bottom of my bed; and on and on.
A friend and I spent weeks tinkering with anything we could find to help get back support. There are still taped together take-out soup containers for lumbar support floating around my apartment. The first version of the BetterBack knees? A cut out from the top of a mega-sized protein bottle. 
Making the latest knee prototypes. So many iterations in between!
I had no idea how many people were suffering from back pain when this all began. I felt way too young to have back pain, personally. Friends or colleagues would see me wearing the early versions of BetterBack and ask to try it. As soon as they did, I would get messages all the time: "Oh hey, I'm flying to New York on Tuesday, any chance I can borrow that thing you wear?" Or "My back is acting up, any chance I can just borrow it until Friday?" I had no idea so many people were suffering. I began to do more research and was blown away by what I found.  I decided to make more -- and invest time and money into making it better. 
Six prototypes later, I began working with manufacturers to build a high quality, well crafted and incredibly comfortable posture strap I would be proud to see my mom wear. And your mom too, if she doesn't have an awesome back.
I'm on Kickstarter for two reasons. One, I'm hoping 500 people will pledge so I can hit the minimum order quantity and produce the very first run of BetterBacks. Even more importantly, I'm hoping to find people who will go on the journey with me to get a better back. I want to hear your story, what has worked and hasn't worked for you in the past, understand how BetterBack helps you and how it can help you better.  Please join me.
Good posture affects your health, your mood and your motivation. Most people only begin to understand the importance of posture after their body is so damaged from slumping that sitting aches become chronic pain. I know because I am one of them.
My mission is to help people be their best selves and unlock their full potential. Without health, that is impossible; it is the foundation for everything else.
I have spent the last few years learning about back pain, trying a huge range of products and therapies, and developing BetterBack with dozens on dozens of bad backs and amazing souls.
The relief and support people feel while wearing BetterBack—and even after—is truly amazing. No matter how many times or tools you’ve tried to sit pain free, BetterBack is like posture training wheels so you can experience and integrate good posture into your life for good.
I have self funded the design, development and sampling for BetterBack. Our final prototype has been well tested and our manufacturers are ready to go. Every dollar pledged will go towards manufacturing, quality assurance, packaging and shipping. 
BetterBack was my first Kickstarter campaign. It has been some of the most amazing and challenging few weeks of my life. If you are thinking of running a crowdfunding campaign, I encourage you to take the leap and go for it. You will connect with the most incredible global community of supporters and get to bring a part of yourself to life. I wanted to share some of the amazingly talented people who contributed to my campaign; maybe one day they will help you with your campaign too.
Industrial Design // I had the chance to work with three amazing industrial designers on the development of BetterBack.
Andy Storms is a softgoods and SolidWorks pro. Smart, thoughtful and a joy to work with. Reach him at andy@neverago.com
Josh Guyot is the go-to guy for innovative product design and custom parts. Shoot him a note at josh@guyotdesigns.com
Liam Woods specializes in the interaction of soft goods, hardware, and the human body. Check him out at liamwoodsdesign.com
Video // Theo Souza at Onsight Media helped me develop my script and shoot/ edit my video. He is incredibly talented and an absolute delight to work with. You can reach him here:  theo@onsight.media
Graphic Design // Peter Green is the wonder who created the graphics on this page, even when I needed something without warning in 20 minutes. :) Check him out at Free Money Studio 
Product Development + Branding // Victor Mathieux was my co-tinkerer in the earliest days of BetterBack, hit the streets with me to test BetterBack on dozens of strangers and was a huge part of its evolution. His branding skills are out of this world. www.victormathieux.com
Photography // Julian Bialowas shot all of the photography on this page in 45 minutes. He is that good. He is also a super talented designer. Check him out at instagram.com/julianbialowas
Marketing // I had an extensive marketing plan developed before I launched my Kickstarter campaign and will be writing about what worked and what didn't on my website katherinekrug.com. The soma creators have a great post and Stonemaier Games has a series of helpful posts on KS marketing.
I wasn't expecting so many marketing companies to reach out after I launched my campaign (be ready for it!) and I decided to try out a handful of them. By far these were the best:
Funded Today - These guys brought a wealth of experience and expertise to my campaign. I just wish I had known about them earlier.  I'm certain I would not have reached $1M without their help. Find them at http://bit.ly/1EMP9eC
BackerClub - These guys have a strong community of engaged Kickstarter backers and a fun rewards club. BackerClub.co 
Special thanks to Dr. Ryan Lawlor for his tremendous help (www.drlawlor.com), Ramon and Renato for helping me test new marketing channels (GrowthHack.com.br), Josh Krigman as a hugely talented writer (joshkrigman.com), Collin Hughes for photography in my video (http://collin-hughes.com/), and Jonathan Swanson, Pam Krug and Peter Dering for their endless support. 
Bear hug to every single one of the backers who supported bringing BetterBack to life! 
Visit us at www.getbetterback.com
How much should I wear it?
Sit in perfect posture for minutes or hours. It is comfortable to wear all day long, but even 15 minutes a day can greatly improve the quality of your life.
Will I look stupid wearing it?
It's hard to believe, but most people don't even notice when you're wearing it. I sit through meals, meetings and flights with BetterBack on and it's only when I'm taking it off that people tend to notice it, with a "you've been wearing that this whole time?!!" The thing that tends to happen next is someone shares their story of back pain and asks to try it on. 
How comfortable are the knee straps?
I have absolutely terrible knees (at one point I was put in two leg casts because of feet and knee injuries, later having surgery on my right knee). We spent a lot of time designing the knee cushions so that the force was widely distributed and comfortable for people who have knee problems *and* back problems.
Can I wear BetterBack while I drive?
Unfortunately, no. BetterBack is not safe to wear driving, or when you need quick leg mobility. It is great for sitting at your desk, eating, meeting, going to a movie, sitting on an airplane, meditating, etc. Note: you can wear BetterBack cross-legged! 
How is this different than the Nada Chair?
Let me start by pouring heaps of praise and adoration on Dr. Toso who came up the knee form to help people with their posture. I have tried the Nada Chair and while I loved the stabilization it offered, it unfortunately hurt my knees very badly to wear after just a few minutes. It wasn’t a solution for me as a result.
BetterBack uses the same knee form as the Nada Chair, but the design and construction of the knee pads, back support and straps are new, incorporating six rounds of prototyping with two amazing Industrial Designers and the feedback of 62 wonderful backs who beta tested it last year and this year. Here are some of the ways BetterBack is different:
Knees, knees, knees!
We use PE (polyethylene) to disperse force and foam to provide cushiony comfort on the knees, so even people with bad knees can wear BetterBack. Because of backer support, everyone’s knee pads will now include thicker compression molded foam for even more durability and comfort. :)
Back pad
BetterBack is worn outside of clothing, but it can still get hot on an airplane, at a game or when things heat up at work. BetterBack combines a perforated foam and spacer mesh for maximum back breathability, without sacrificing lumbar support.
Straps & Adjustability
Strap adjusters are placed where your hands naturally rest, for easy tightening and loosening. Quick slip keepers keep the straps flush against BetterBack for a clean and minimalist look.
Usability
We’ve developed two ways to make sure people can put BetterBack on quickly and correctly. The first is using a poly cotton fabric for the outside materials and a spacer mesh for the inside materials that touch your body. On inside surfaces, we’ve also included easy to read icons so you know exactly which way is up without any guessing.
Materials
We want people to feel good and confident wearing BetterBack, so we’ve sourced high quality, durable materials similar to what you’d find in fashion, rather than in the medical section.
This all started in my kitchen, trying to make something to help me with my excruciating sciatica pain. My friends and people I’d meet all around San Francisco turned out to need it too. Never in my wildest dreams did I think it would be such a success on Kickstarter! I believe Dr. Toso was a visionary and I hope to see much more attention and innovation on the knee form/pelvis stabilization in the years to come, just as innovation on lumbar support products mean people looking can find something just right for them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have extensive manufacturing and operational experience (I used to manufacture interiors to large condominium buildings and hotels), plus two manufacturers capable of delivering BetterBack. One thing I know for sure: something unexpected always comes up. I’ve buffered my timeline to account for unexpected curveballs that may impact the schedule, so I can deliver BetterBack to you on time. These things could also impact the delivery schedule:

Volume - sometimes Kickstarter campaigns wildly exceed a project creator’s expectation. If we hit huge volume, it may push the timeline back, likely to the tune of 14 days. 

Really awesome ideas - I know I will receive some amazing ideas and insights from the Kickstarter community. I don't want to lose out on the ability to deliver you a superior product, if it can be reasonably done.

Freight - Port closures and customs delays happen. It’s impossible to know when and for how long. The buffer calculated into the timeline should cover this, but it is an unknown.

My goal is to deliver the highest quality, most effective posture strap on the market. I will work my back off for you and deliver transparency all the way through. Feel free to reach out to me personally anytime you have a thought, idea or a question at kk@getbetterback.com.

Last but not least: any pledge amount brings us closer to our goal -- both of hitting our first production run and of building awareness around good posture. Please click the ‘Back This Project’ button at the top of the page, or help us spread the word by sharing this page with the people you love. Big thanks and a pat on the.... !

campaign.story:
THANKS TO OUR AMAZING BACKERS we raised over $200,000! Wow, and thanks!
To order Tesla vs. Edison for yourself or otherwise inquire to us, please email: hello (at) artana.com
Later we will set up a page for the game on our website, www.artana.com
All set up and ready to play!
Tesla vs. Edison is a light-to-medium weight strategy game for 2-5 players. You are an investor who teams up and creates a company with one of the exciting, visionary inventors leading the nascent electric light and power industry of 1880s and 1890s America.
Your inventor, along with other famous people of the period that you hire as employees in your company, work together to claim electric projects across the United States, advance your company's technology, engage in propaganda wars with the other companies, and buy and sell stock from your and your competitors companies.
Tesla vs. Edison plays quickly and provides interesting decisions while telling the exciting story of the birth of electricity.
Per chi è interessato alla versione Italiana del gioco, c’è la campagna di Tesla vs Edison su Giochistarter: http://www.giochistarter.it/scheda.php?item=1000041&crowd=1&lingua=1
1 Large Game Board
5 Inventor Cards
18 Luminary Cards
35 Stock Certificate Cards
$1.14 million of beautiful paper money
102 Cardboard Markers
12 Page Rulebook
 +18 Propaganda Cards!
"Very, very impressive...it's got a lot of stuff going on and they all really work together in concert. I'm really impressed by it." - https://www.youtube.com/user/rahdo
"I have been waiting for a brutal, aggressive, area control stock game. Now I have one - and it's awesome."
- UndeadViking
"Tesla vs. Edison: War of Currents couples an immersive theme with a game that is easy to learn and yet surprisingly deep in terms of its strategy."
- Alex Rosenwald, Board Game Quest (read the full review: http://www.boardgamequest.com/tesla-vs-edison-preview/)
Follow us on Twitter and Like us on Facebook, in both cases @artanagames!
 https://twitter.com/artanagames
https://www.facebook.com/artanagames
It is also Asia friendly! :-)
We are shipping the game from three locations: first in China, then in the United States, and finally in the European Union. We are offering a $10 shipping discount per game purchased. This makes shipping in the United States free, and shipping to other parts of the world in some cases relatively inexpensive.
Given this strategy, backers from different parts of the world will get their games at different times. While the rewards on the backer levels say September here is a schedule of when we expect the games to be shipped to different places, in conjunction with other milestones:
1. China/Asia - ship to backers by or before July
2. United States/"Rest of World" - ship to backers by or before August
3. European Union - ship to backers by or before September
4. Broad Distribution - released just in time for the SPIEL '15 (October 8).
The summer convention season is the most important for our business and thus, once all of the games have arrivedin the U.S. via container ship, we will sell at conventions - particularly GenCon - which in some cases may occur before backers have received their games from our fulfillment partner. It will only be sold there at full MSRP, $60. We will also offer any backers who elect for it free pickup at the convention.
The attention GenCon offers this game is so valuable to our business. We hope that, in backing us, you want us to be successful beyond just receiving your reward from this campaign. If you are not happy with this policy we fully understand your choosing not to back this campaign. Thank you for even considering offering your support - we are grateful!
We've already begun the early design process on the first Tesla vs. Edison expansion. However, we want to invite you, our Kickstarter backers, to share your ideas about what we should or could include, and express your preferences about which ideas you'd most like to see!
During the campaign we'd like to invite your suggestions in the Kickstarter comments. When the appropriate stretch goals are reached we will take all of your and our ideas that seem viable to us and within the range of things we would consider acceptable and put them all up for a vote by out backers. Whichever of those gets the most votes will definitely be included. We hope to have a few rounds of voting and thus backer contributions to the design. The expansion won't be limited to those things but will definitely include there. Here are some art examples, as well as just conceptual ideas:
6th player expansion with a historical company
6th player expansion with an ahistorical company. Actually it is a real company just not in the electricity business.
Female luminaries. Real inventors and entrepreneurs who thrived in other fields during the same-ish period.
 Other current expansion ideas:
- "Robot" to allow solitaire, 1 player games
- New/alternate board and project maps
- "Storytelling" game resolutions: narrative outcomes based on the final game conditions, in addition to simply appointing a winner
- Additional, historical "War of Currents" luminaries
- Conflict cards that bring more conflict, player-vs-player spicy-ness into the game: labor strikes, sabotage, shady dealings, and other historical elements from the real War of Currents infusing into the game
The plan for the expansion is to serve as modules, not an all-or-nothing. So, whatever we end up shipping, you can take or leave (for example) the conflict cards. View the expansion as ways to customize and extend the game for your group and game session, not as a set template that is a wholesale replacement for the base game.
We expect to Kickstart this as its own project in the first half of 2016.
We are a new game company, built by experienced designers, developers, artists, and games industry business people. We are combining our collective 40+ years in the business to design, develop, and deliver games that offer fresh themes, innovative mechanics, and smooth playability.
The Tesla vs. Edison project is the culmination of key contributions from our team:
- On his own and as Conquistador Games, designer Dirk Knemeyer has run five successful Kickstarters. His latest games, the War Stories series, are being celebrated as "state-of-the-art" in the innovations they brought to the well-worn tactical combat genre. He is a host of www.thegamedesignroundtable.com, which is worth a listen for anyone interested in game design.
- Developers Rob Seater and John Coveyou brought very different experiences to the product development process. Seater has developed many different games, including one of the best-designed games in print, Glory to Rome. He brings  a rigor and deep experience that none of the Knemeyer/Conquistador games of the past has at their disposal. Coveyou, himself the successful publisher of two Kickstarter games via his Genius Games, has a deep mathematics and science background in both university and his professional career. He combined these methods and processes with his insatiable energy to infuse the project with an additional development layer.
- Artists Heiko Günther and Jess Riola combine skill in making beautiful things with years of experience providing art, illustration, and design in the games industry. Günther has served as the art director and designer for all of the Knemeyer/Conquistador games. Along with winning awards for his work on these games he has contributed art to more than 20 different tabletop games. Riola provided the custom illustration for Tesla vs. Edison and has contributed wonderful art in the video games industry for more than seven years.
- Nils Herzmann, who provides leadership across marketing and sales for everything at Artana, has been part of the convention staff at Asmodee, the largest game company in the world, for more than a decade. His participation is new to our publishing process.
We also want to thank some very good people beyond the above team for donating free time in amounts large and small to contribute to or advise us about the Kickstarter portion of this project: Brian Liston, Jamey Stegmaier, Nate Lovett.
Our project video includes alterations made to original images that are generously-made-available by people thru creative commons attribution. Check out the full credits and information for these images on the YouTube page for the video: http://youtu.be/rQv17CaGSmQ
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are so appreciative for the opportunity to create games, and for Kickstarter connecting directly with our backers and future customers!

Artana is extending and improving on the legacy established by Conquistador Games and Dirk Knemeyer. Since 2012 that team had five Kickstarter projects, spanning five total games and one very large campaign for metal gaming coins. Three of those games were delivered essentially on-time and our backers were happy with our service. The last two games, part of the same campaign, suffered from the original designer dropping out of the project literally within days of the end of the project. We pushed our entire publishing schedule back a year and redesigned that game from the ground-up in order to fulfill successfully to our backers, which we did albeit almost a year late. The coins campaign, as a product of its own success, unlocked numerous stretch goals that were asked for by the backers and naively agreed to by our team. The problem was that we did not have a clear view of the production and fulfillment nightmares that this would cause. In trying to satisfy our backers and meet their various needs we agreed to a lot of things that we were too ignorant to realize would make that campaign push out and be more than a year late. The fulfillment for that project is currently in process. Backers getting the coins are effusive in their praise for the quality of the final product.

Our team felt joy and pride in our successes and shame and frustration in our failures. Along with learning from those experiences, we've reached out and created a larger and more extended team to participate with this game. We believe that we have created an approach to Tesla vs. Edison that will guarantee this is an exemplar of a Kickstarter campaign:

1. The game is completely designed - we continue to tune the economy and are trying to make the rulebook ever-better, but we believe in the game as-is, right now, today - and the production process has begun. The Kickstarter is timed to end at the point that we need to put in our deposit, and commit to final quantities. This ensures the highest possible chance of delivering on-time to our backers short of pre-printing the game - in which case, why would we be Kickstarting to begin with?!

2. Stretch goals that upgrade the base game have already been discussed with our production partner and will not add production time to include. They have been 100% incorporated into the production engineering for the game.

3. We will not have stretch goals outside of the upgrades to the game that require physical shipping to backers. There's lots of cool things that we could do about Tesla, Edison, and the other rocking personalities from the War of Currents that would both be awesome and send us back into "ZOMG this is going to be super late because we were so successful!" territory. We simply won't sign up for that. Maybe one of you could do a Kickstarter for some fantastic Tesla memorabilia? We will happily point our backers to it! :-)

Whether our Kickstarters delivered on time or late we always always always always always delivered a quality product. Bottom line. Now, as a larger team here at Artana, our ability to be on-time and continuing to increase the quality of what we do is stronger than it's ever been. Support us, we'll make you glad you did!

Thank you, thank you, thank you for your support!!!

Greetings Tesla vs. Edison Backers!
Thanks to you, Tesla vs. Edison was a tremendous success on Kickstarter and beyond. We're deeply grateful for your support in backing Tesla vs. Edison: War of Currents, and we'd like to ask for your participation in our newest campaign, Corrupted Kingdoms (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/artana/corrupted-kingdoms).
Corrupted Kingdoms is a 30-60 minute light strategy game of intrigue and political machinations for 2-6 players set in a seemingly-ideal fantasy realm. You play one of six monstrous corporations using your infernal minions - devils, goblins, golems, and zombies - to vie for control of the realm’s noble government. campaign.story:
Plug in your phone, take a picture, and get a photo in seconds!
Then watch your photos come to life on screen magically!
Prynt is compatible with iOS and Android phones including:
  Forbes: “Prynt is perfect for those of us that want to quickly frame a photo shortly after taking them — without having to worry about ordering copies online or printing them at a retail store.” 
CNN: “The smartphone case that can print your selfies and cameras that fit just about anywhere was among the highlights from the 2015 Consumer Electronics Show.” 
NBC: “It's like Instagram, but in real life! This case turns your smartphone into a Polaroid-style camera that prints photos. Bonus: Those photos turn into augmented reality videos when viewed on the phone's screen” 
TechCrunch: “This is genius! It’s a Snapchat that you can hand off to someone and so much more.” 
Slash Gear: “Prynt Case: Using their app, one can see those printed pictures come alive, giving it the Harry Potter universe's living portrait feel.” 
Engadget: “So what is the Prynt Case? Only the greatest thing to happen to mobile photography since Instagram” 
             Ever wanted to share a photo with a friend and not have to put it on the internet? Now you can, with Prynt: the first ever instant camera case for smartphones. Just plug in your iPhone or Android device, snap a photo or choose one from your favorite social network, and print it out in thirty seconds!
Prynt is portable, lightweight and fun! Snap and print photos anywhere, anytime. 
It's ideal for when you're out with your friends, sightseeing, or capturing a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Gifts and cards become more special when you include an instant photo. Take it with you on the go and never miss the chance to shoot and share some everyday magic.
We also designed Prynt to be modular so it can fit different types of phones. The part of the case that contains the dock can be easily changed based on the phone model. That means if you upgrade or change phones, you don't need a whole new Prynt Case, just order a new dock adapter from us and keep printing.
Lastly, we worked hard to design a beautiful object you'll love to carry. We think our black, white, pink and blue models are gorgeous and the matching (animal-friendly) leather grips are quite chic.
Plus, you'll never have to deal with ink or cartridges because we use a special paper with the ink embedded inside. Just load the paper and print away!
The case holds 10 sheets of paper, and refills will be available through our app. We'll include one pack of photos (10 sheets) with each Prynt Case reward on Kickstarter. Want more paper? For every $25 you add to your pledge, we'll send you 50 extra sheets.
Each print-out is more than a photo — it's a video! While you're posing for a photo, our app records a short video and stores it in the cloud. When you hold your phone over the printed image, our app will automatically scan and recognize it, showing your movie on screen in augmented reality. 
You can see the videos in your friends' photos, too! Print and pass your photos around for a creative new way to tell your story. It's like a secret message in every photo — embed any kind of surprise you can think of!
The Prynt app is under development and will be released this summer. Our goal is to carry the beauty and simplicity of the case onto the screen of your smartphone for a seamless experience.
In addition to taking a picture, you can select one from your camera roll, Facebook or Instagram. You'll also be able to enhance your photos with frames, filters and personalizations in the app.
To embed a video in a print, use the app to record your movie, then select the frame you want to print:
Order more paper through the app too, and we'll send it right to you! The app can monitor your paper usage and let you know when it's a good time to reorder so you'll never run out! Plus, your shipping and billing info will be stored so reorders are a breeze.
Want to see Prynt in 3D? Press play:
We were inspired by classic instant cameras and wanted to recreate the magical experience of sharing physical photos with our loved ones. We were also convinced we could enhance this experience by incorporating our smartphones, which are always with us and help us stay connected.

After developing the alpha prototype, we were the first French startup selected for Haxlr8r, a hardware accelerator program based in Shenzhen, China. We came away from the experience even more dedicated to our original vision of a modern instant camera that would be both portable and beautiful.

Dear Backers,
Happy almost-Christmas! As we’ve undertaken the near-herculean challenge of delivering a crowd-funded hardware product in less than 10 months, we’re pretty thrilled to say that nearly every reward is in the process of being fulfilled :)
Yes, we know know we’re late, and we regret that. Did you know that, on average, 84% of Kickstarter projects are late? We didn’t either, but even really big hardware projects like Pebble and Oculus were over six months late. This is not an excuse, but just to say that we now know we were probably a little too optimistic when we gave our timelines. We also realize that not everyone has received the Kickstarter updates along the way, and some backers felt in the dark about the delays. For that, we’re sorry too. We are grateful to you all for sticking with us!

How is everyone? We have been working really hard to give all of you the best Christmas gift ever and today we have great news: our production line is up and running and we are shipping!

Articles about mild cold exposure and calorie burn have appeared in:
Our Story
I sell a vest full of ice that's designed to burn calories.
I'm a NASA scientist and a professor. What you're about to read is going to sound like science fiction, but it's not.  Scientists have spent decades studying how mild cold exposure can enhance calorie burn.  Quietly, and without fuss, the evidence for cold exposure induced calorie burn has been accumulating.  It's time to bring the science to the public. That's what I'm here to do: to explain to you what is probably the most novel, evidence-based calorie-burning idea that's come out of the scientific community in many years, and to tell you how you can take advantage of it without pain, without discomfort, and without taking more than 2 minutes of time out of your busy day. With KickStarter's help, we'll be able to bring this vest to the masses at a reasonable price.
Let's be blunt: there is no magic pill for weight loss, and The Cold Shoulder is no exception to that rule.  The cold, hard truth is that the foundation of weight control is your diet. In order to maintain a healthy weight, do what grandma told you: eat your veggies, cut the fat off your steak, and avoid junk food, especially sweets.  If you continue to eat junk, then no amount of exercise, cold exposure, or weirdly named supplements or powders will help you lose weight. The vest can burn up to 500 calories per day if used as directed, but you can easily nullify the effect by eating an extra 500 extra calories.  So don't expect that you can continue to eat junk food, wear the vest, and lose weight.  You can't.
But if you are already eating well and getting moderate exercise and want to accelerate your calorie-burning efforts by burning excess calories while at rest, there's no simpler, easier, or more time-efficient way than wearing our vest.
We'd like to emphasize exactly under what conditions The Cold Shoulder can induce the burning of excess calories.  Basically, you need to be in an environment where you are otherwise at a comfortable temperature, and you are not exercising.  If you are sitting down at rest in a room (or your car, or whatever) that is at a comfortable temperature, then wearing The Cold Shoulder directly from the freezer, and with a shirt underneath, will extract heat from your body and cause you to burn extra calories in order to stay warm.
If you are in a hot environment, the The Cold Shoulder will help you stay cool, but it won't burn excess calories, because you're not cold.  If you are working out in the gym, then The Cold Shoulder can help you stay cool, but will not enhance your calorie burn, because you're not cold in that environment.  If the vest is not cold, or if the ice has all melted, it will not induce excess calorie burn. Remember that the goal of The Cold Shoulder is to force you to burn calories at a time when you otherwise would not: sitting down, at rest, in a comfortable environment at room temperature.
So, to burn excess calories, wear The Cold Shoulder sitting on the couch watching the game, or in front of your computer, or in your car during your commute.  Any time you'd normally just be sitting around comfortable---that's the time to don The Cold Shoulder and enhance your calorie burn.
Whether you're an athlete, an actor/model, or a couch potato, almost everybody today could benefit from burning a few more calories without expending time or effort.  Note that The Cold Shoulder cannot claim to diagnose, treat, prevent, or cure any disease, illness or condition.
The Problem - Exercise is not the only way to burn calories
The first thing I always hear when I say I’m touting a “cold vest” is, “I don’t like being cold.” But think of all the other crazy things people do in order to try to lose excess fat. Starving themselves? Eating zero-calorie clay just to feel full, which carries a risk of arsenic poising? Exhausting themselves in the gym? Ingesting questionable supplements that, if they work at all, have side effects like insomnia or over‐stimulation? How about wearing a corset just to appear thinner? Drug injections? Liposuction? Freezing fat cells? Gastro‐intestinal surgery? Considering these options, wearing a cool, calorie-burning vest is pretty tame in comparison. The Cold Shoulder has no known side effects. Users who start skeptical end up wearing it routinely, and even find they look forward to putting it on at the end of a long day.
There is an aspect of the calorie equation that has been largely neglected for too long.  There is a huge hole in our collective knowledge. Although exercise is definitely good, most people think that exercise is the only way to burn excess calories.   But it's not.
The Solution - Burn excess calories using mild cold exposure
In addition to exercise, there’s another, much less well-known but scientifically well-established way to burn calories. It’s called mild cold exposure. Basically, if you extract heat from your body, even if you’re sitting on your couch in front of the T.V., your body will need to burn calories to stay warm. This is a scientific fact – and I should know,  since I work at NASA with a group of scientists that study ice. The trick is to figure out how to harness mild cold exposure without being uncomfortable.
The idea of using mild cold exposure to burn calories has slowly started to percolate into the popular media. Articles on the subject have appeared in many places, including the venues mentioned at the top of this page. The problem is that they often recommend painful or impractical methods of cold exposure, like cold showers or ice baths. Very few people have the courage to try that.
I was studying the science of how cold exposure burns calories, when I had a light-bulb moment. I thought, "If cold exposure burns calories, there’s got to be a way I can harness its power to help ordinary people increase their calorie burn." That’s when I began the work that eventually led me to develop The Cold Shoulder. It's a vest that drapes ice over the shoulder and back, and extracts calories while you wear it. The vest looks like this:
The Cold Shoulder Calorie Burning Vest
I have put it to the scientific test and proved this vest's efficacy in controlled clinical trials. Here are a few before-and-after shots after just 3 weeks of using The Cold Shoulder:
Results of 3 weeks of wearing The Cold Shoulder
Considering all the crazy things that people do to burn excess fat, from starvation diets to liposuction, a vest that burns calories while you continue about your day seems pretty tame, don't you think?
Why You’ll Love The Cold Shoulder
1. Burns calories without exercise. Whether you’re a gym rat or a couch potato, our ice vest will burn excess calories for you – the equivalent of up to 500 calories a day. This can more than double the calorie deficit you'd get from dieting alone.
2. Saves time. It takes about 30s to get the vest out of the freezer and put it on. Then you go about your day until the ice melts, and it's another thirty seconds to take it off and put it back into the freezer.  Do that twice a day, and you've spent 2 minutes to burn 500 calories. Compare that to the same calories burned in a gym workout, which can consume several hours once you include travel time, change room time, and waiting for the machines that are busy when you want to use them. Two minutes vs. two hours, for the same 500 calories.
3. It’s effective. The idea is based on decades of research by scientists from Harvard to Cambridge and beyond. Mild cold exposure burns calories – it’s a scientific fact. The only question is how to do it comfortably, effortlessly.... even fashionably!
4. It’s comfortable. The first time you wear it, yes, it'll feel cold. But you won’t shiver. After trying it a few times, you’ll hardly notice you’re wearing it. Some of our current users actually look forward to putting it on.
5. It gets more effective the more you use it. As your body acclimatizes to periodic mild cold exposure, it gets more used to the idea of turning on your internal furnace to burn calories. It gets easier and easier to burn off more and more calories, just like going to the gym gets easier the more you do it. This is exactly opposite to drugs or supplements, which usually decrease in effectiveness as your body builds a tolerance to them.
6. It’s fashionable. You can wear it pretty much anywhere. I've worn it to fancy French restaurants, as part of a 3-piece suit. I even tried wearing it on my wedding day, but my fiancé – now wife – decided it wasn’t quite ready for that.
7. Sold direct at wholesale prices. Expect to pay significantly more once this is available in retail stores. There’s no middle man on KickStarter. We’ll manufacture your vest and ship it directly to you.
How Does It Work? 
The Science Behind Cold-exposure Based Calorie Burn
You don't need to be a scientist to understand that too much cold exposure – such as, say, floating in the North Atlantic after the Titanic sank – can extract so many calories so quickly that it can kill you.  On the other hand, mild cold exposure is perfectly healthy, and has been studied by scientists for decades as a way to burn calories.
For example, Olympic swimmers burn many more calories per day than other Olympic athletes, and it has nothing to do with the exercise. It’s the water. They spend their day in water that’s 20 degrees (F) below their body temperature, and this temperature difference makes them burn way more calories than the exercise alone.
Due to the temperature difference between the body and the water, heat flows from the body to the water, burning many more calories than the exercise alone.
Any mild cold exposure causes your body to burn extra calories, whether it’s a cold day outside, air conditioning set too high, or your skin being in contact with a cold object. Scientists have been studying the effects of mild cold exposure for decades, and it’s a well documented fact that mild cold exposure induces calorie burn.
Our vest, The Cold Shoulder, has ice draped over the shoulder and across the back:
Due to the temperature difference between the body and the ice vest, heat flows from the body to the vest, causing your body to burn calories.
These are the most comfortable places to put the ice because that's where your body has the fewest nerve endings. It's also the most scientifically valid place to put the ice because, just under the skin of the shoulders and back, there's a type of tissue called Brown Adipose Tissue (BAT). BAT burns calories when you encounter mild cold. Our clinical trials show that wearing our vest twice a day for about an hour burns up to 500 calories more per day than you'd burn without it.
Example clinical trial result - Nick Hamilton
Below is a graph of the body fat of Nick Hamilton over a 16-week period. Nick was one of our early testers of The Cold Shoulder. He was on a 16 week, tightly controlled diet and exercise regimen. The only change Nick made in the last 2 weeks was to start using The Cold Shoulder ice vest. You can see how much it accelerated his fat loss.
Nick Hamilton greatly accelerated his fat loss just by wearing The Cold Shoulder for an hour each morning and evening, for the last 2 weeks of his 16-week diet + exercise regimen.
Evidence from independent scientists
For more info on cold exposure and calorie burn, see this page. Note that some of it is rather technical---definitely not light reading. But if you want some of the cold, hard scientific facts from independent researchers, this is the place to start. Most of the research was done even before I conceived of The Cold Shoulder, so you know it's independent and objective.
Our Mission
We want to bring the most functional, comfortable, and stylish clothing-based calorie-burning aid to the global market. We want to spread the word that burning calories doesn’t have to require time-consuming gym visits, sweaty exercise, crazy calorie-restricted diet fads, or taking untested, questionable supplements with unknown side effects. Instead, we advocate that a healthy lifestyle must contain not only a healthy diet and moderate exercise, but also a regular dose of mild cold exposure.
Why We Need You!
Although we have the designs and prototypes finished and our manufacturer stands ready to produce the vests, the cost of production is high unless we fulfill minimum order quantities. In order to cover the costs of fabric and production at this level, we need to commit to this minimum order quantity to secure the best deal, which can then be passed onto you, with special rewards exclusively offered here on Kickstarter!
Will It Fit Me?
We have sizes to fit everybody from XS to XXX-L. We’ll get your sizing option after the funding period is over.

Women’s sizes: Although the current vest is unisex, it's not particularly flattering to the female form. If we reach about $40k in funding, we will have enough spare capital to hire a female clothing designer to design a version more tailored to the female form. We envision it as having a fashionable waist-level fabric body-wrapping belt to adjust the waist size, rather than Velcro.  If we get here, and you want a female version of the vest, you'll be able to choose that after the funding period is over, but it'll probably add about an extra month to your delivery date.
Production Plan
Once funded, we will put in our order for materials. Delivery and preparation of materials may take 2-4 weeks. During that time we’ll confirm sizing for all of our backers and prepare the manufacturing process. To ensure quality construction, we’re personally overseeing manufacturing of our vests in the Los Angeles Fashion district, which requires 4-6 weeks. We source our ice packs from the USA. Our Guarantee

Ghost Cards
Here's a look at some of the Ghost Cards. Take a look at how they react when hit or missed and all of the things that differentiate them from each other.
The Grey Lady may be shy, but she's not afraid to stop your roughhousing in its tracks. If this librarian has paid your scenario a visit, she won't go quietly! If you do manage to get her attention, she leaves you only with your thoughts, waiting to cramp your style in the next adventure! The Grey Lady will add a challenge to many scenarios, especially if playing more than one in a single session. 
Sandman will include a custom scenario specifically designed for him.
Zombie Taxi Drivers are eager to take the Ecto-1 on a joy ride around town! Once one of them reaches your ride, he immobilizes it until you get rid of him, but not until he sends it speeding off, ghost rider style!
The Zombie Taxi Drivers will come with a scenario specifically designed for them. However, they can also be used as Class 1 replacements and companions in base game scenarios. 
Note: When differently named Ghosts share a Class, roll a d6 for each, with the higher roll making an appearance. Impossible Mode versions get +3 to this roll!
Player Cards
Up to 4 players take on the roles of the Ghostbusters and attempt to return balance between the Spirit World and ours, busting ghosts and sealing the gates from which they’re invading. Completing a scenario requires teamwork, planning, and resourcefulness.  
Melanie Ortiz keeps a watchful eye on her coworkers, and a closer eye on her targets. Her selfless acts bring her closer to knowing herself, and in turn, in how to deal with the approaching end game of the other worldly intruders.
Janine’s quick response time is her key attribute at the front desk and as a Ghostbuster! When she spots a newly summoned Ghost, she acts fast, and when she sees a fellow Ghostbuster in a tight situation, she leaps into action!
Kylie thinks things through, to the point where she anticipates what's coming! Her research into the forbidden arts has granted her insight into the dark intentions of her enemies, whose actions seem entirely random to everyone else.
Ron is always trying to prove he has the chops to be a better Ghostbuster, even if that means putting himself in danger. He's no schlub when it comes to tech and the closer he gets to a threat, the more brazen he becomes.
Peter Venkman is a risk-taker who does his best work in close proximity to ghosts.
Illustrated by Dan Schoening, sculpted by Samuel H. Greenwell
Ray Stantz excels at removing slime from his fellow Ghostbusters.
Illustrated by Dan Schoening, sculpted by Samuel H. Greenwell
Egon Spengler is a wild man with his proton pack, but learns from his mistakes.
Illustrated by Dan Schoening, sculpted by Samuel H. Greenwell
Winston Zeddemore aids the team by being the best at depositing trapped ghosts.
Illustrated by Dan Schoening, sculpted by Samuel H. Greenwell
Featured ghosts from the movies, cartoons, comics, and toylines have unique abilities as well, in terms of how they move and react to your actions.
The game features 3 campaigns, each with 4 unique scenarios. It’s a fast-paced game: each scenario takes approximately 30 intense minutes to play. Every campaign concludes with an epic battle against an iconic boss character.
The game uses dice to resolve a lot of the action, so it’s never the same game twice! The three types of dice represent the proton packs and ghost traps, the unpredictable movements of the ghosts, and the chaotic activity of the gates. During each turn, players move, shoot proton streams, deposit trapped ghosts, use unique character abilities, and drive the Ecto-1 to complete objectives. 
Each scenario’s map is constructed using double-sided tiles, featuring street and park imagery by the talented Robb Mommaerts. With a starter mode and a challenge mode, Ghostbusters: The Board Game will keep you enthralled for hours!
Here is a link to a Rules Primer to give you a bit of insight into specific scenario gameplay!  https://bit.ly/1vGYVAl
Here is an introductory video that goes through the basic elements of the game!
PLAY

The video below features a full playthrough of one of our several introductory scenarios! 
And if that wasn’t enough, here is Part 2 of the playthrough!
To create the best game possible, we’ve collaborated with some incredible people: game designers, avid game players, and Ghostbusters fans. This project is on Kickstarter because we want to make this game extra special for you. We want to provide you many ways to customize your experience with a selection of cool add-ons and Kickstarter exclusives you can't get anywhere else, including a snazzier version of the game box design. And we can’t wait to announce some of the amazing stretch goals! Basically, you get the version of the game you want, and you get it before anyone else.

From the snow-capped peaks of the Himalayas comes the Yeti Squad. Carrying out the Bigfoot Patrol mission to discover hairy cryptids across the globe, the Yeti Squad membership kit is a paranormal passport to cryptozoological exploration and adventure on remote continents! Or maybe it's just a really elaborate, limited edition artist-created merchandise-based art project — you decide!
For this campaign, the goal is to get the #2 embroidered patch in the "Bigfoot Patrol" series made: Yeti Squad! 100% Sasquatch approved.
=== UPDATE ===
100% Funded — But Not Finished Yet: we reached our funding goal 6 days in, but there are still stretch goals to reach so I can add in some more FREE merch!
Stretch goal #1 ($1,000), window clings of the Yeti Squad badge, has been met!
Stretch Goal #2 ($1,250) window clings of the original Bigfoot Patrol badge, has also been met! 
Stretch Goal #3 ($1,500) Yeti Squad badge screen print has been met!
Stretch Goal #4 ($1,750) Yeti silhouette die-cut sticker has been met!
Those will all be included for free if you pledge at the $25 reward level or higher! And yes, you can increase your pledge to take advantage of this!
Next up is Stretch Goal #5 ($2,000): the Yeti silhouette embroidered patches. And rest assured that if we exceed $2,000 by another $250 (and another, and another), I will be adding more FREE stuff! 
All we have to do is raise more money, and you get more stuff for free. Win-win.
P.S. The Yeti buttons/pins have been upgraded to a glow-in-the-dark version!
=== END UPDATE ===
Perfect for your backpack, sleeping bag (popular with scouting and camping enthusiasts). You kids will love these more than you will (yes, you can order more than one!), and if they are in the Boy Scouts or Girls Scouts, these are a superb addition to the patch collection as I've been told by many happy customers/fans of the original Bigfoot Patrol patch.
Yeti Squad embroidered patch artwork (2.8" x 3" final size)
The Rewards: Membership Kit
The embroidered patch will ship as part of a new Yeti Squad "membership kit" which includes the Yeti Squad embroidered patch (2.8" x 3"), a 1" Yeti-themed pin, and a Bigfoot Patrol: Yeti Squad membership card. There are also limited edition kits, which come with an artist certificate of authenticity, signed and numbered in a limited edition of 50. 
All limited edition items will be assigned lower numbers to the higher pledge amounts, in the order received. In other words, those who pledge $100 will get lower edition number kits and prints than those who pledge $50, and so on.
The limited edition prints will be screen-printed by hand by Sire Press on French Brand Premium Papers at 8.5" x 11" size. The print will be an original, limited edition of 50 for this campaign only.
Photos of the actual items in the initial "Bigfoot Patrol" Membership Kit artist merch series. Provided to give an idea of the quality level of the final merchandise.
The Rewards: Levels
The pledge rewards are simple: I am offering four levels of reward, with some reward levels offering limited edition versions of the membership kits:
Embroidered Patch
Membership Kit (Patch, Card & Pin)
Membership Kit + signed & numbered limited edition 8.5"x11" print
Membership Kit + signed & numbered limited edition 8.5"x11" print + original Bigfoot art (with both pencil drawing & color pencil drawing levels)
The limited edition kits are only available at reward levels $50, $100, $150 and $250. 
There will be 25 limited edition kits available for the Kit + Print level, 
There will be 25 limited edition kits available for the Kit + Print + Original Art level: 15 kits for the pencil art reward level, 10 kits for the color art reward level.
The highest reward level ($250) includes everything in the $150 level, plus you get the #1 signed and numbered kit and #1 signed and numbered original limited-edition print.
Multiple Items: Add-Ons
There has been a lot of interest in obtaining multiple patches, buttons/pins and/or multiple kits. I've decided the best way to handle this is with add-on purchases. The way it works is simple: just add the amount of the extra items you want to your pledge. For example, if you want one kit and three patches, just add $15 to your $10 pledge and when the campaign ends (successfully, of course), the wrap-up survey will ask you what add-ons you want.
Add-on pricing is simple: $5 for a patch, $10 for a membership kit, $1 per button/pin. You can order up to 10 of each per Kickstarter's rules.
Bigfoot Patrol Add-Ons
The original limited-edition, signed and numbered Bigfoot Patrol Membership Kit series sold out, but I am making available a "Standard Edition" for people who missed out initially. If you want to get either a Bigfoot Patrol embroidered patch or the complete basic membership kit (patch, membership card and pin), just add on $5 per patch and/or $10 per kit to your pledge. Feel free to mix and match. And yes you can get just the button/pins for $1 each as well.
Split-view comparison of the final embroidered patch with the original artwork. Pretty cool, huh?
Campaign Background
The Kickstarter campaign for the first "Bigfoot Patrol" project wasn't fully funded. But I went ahead and had the patches produced as well as a subset of the items (stickers, cards, buttons/pins) and learned a lot from both the Kickstarter process and the production and shipping process. The patches and the Bigfoot Patrol Membership Kit went over extremely well, which is why I am moving on to have the next patch created. I pretty much sold out of the initial run of 100 kits, so I will be aiming for the same amount here.
Campaign Focus
This time I will be aiming a bit more directly at getting the patches made, and less on the pricier items like the t-shirts — and believe it or not, stickers. The prints and original art were popular items, so I wanted to make sure they were included despite being expensive items to ship.
The artwork for the "Yeti Squad" limited edition print. Will be silkscreen printed by hand by Sire Press on Mr. French premium paper, then signed and numbered by the artist.
Stretch Goals
I have some ideas for stretch goal incentives to add to the kit if we hit certain goals after the campaign minimum is met. I'll be updating this with more info on those as the campaign progresses.
There has already been requests for window clings for your car so I think those will be the first stretch goals. Stickers are always fun so we will do a Kickstarter-exclusive Yeti silhouette sticker, and if the campaign does really well, Yeti silhouette patches!

if we reach $1,500: Yeti silhouette die-cut stickers!
if we reach $2,500: Yeti silhouette patches!

campaign.story:
For years I have worked in the food service industry, while living in Houston, Texas I worked in restaurants, country clubs and hotels and was never really satisfied with the work. Then when i moved back to Ohio in 1991 I started working for a caterer, I loved it. I loved how she designed the food and how she was able to make the buffets so beautiful using flowers, fancy trays and bowls; I learned so much from her. Then I started working for what I would call an everyday caterer.  We did total off-site catering we would cater small and large parties,  unlike the first caterer I worked for this caterer used wire racks with disposable water pans and 1/2 pans frequently. There were times when we would fill an entire van with just 1/2 pans full of food. When we would get to the site and set everything up we would continuously refill the buffet after every 12-15 guest went through the line. It was tedious to say the least. 
With my experience 3 1/2 pans of food would equal 1 water pan of food.
One day I said to myself it would be great if we could use a water pan as a food pan inside the water pan itself. The problem with that was if you put the 2 pans together the water would come out immediately from in between the pans and if you lit the sterno fuel you would burn the bottom of the food. So I thought about it off and on for a few years and could not come up with a solution. I had tried quite a few ideas but to no avail.
Then one day about a year ago I came up with the idea that I could put a support rack in between both water pans and put water under the rack and still be able to use sterno fuel to keep the food hot.
Support Rack
 Then there was the issue of keeping the heat and steam between the 2 pans and not escape as it would between the gap of the pans.
So that's when I got the idea that what ever fabric I used it should be insulated. I thought of pot holders and what was used on the inside to allow you to pick up a hot pan and discovered insul-brite, it is the inner lining of the pot holder that repels the heat away from your hands. A thought occurred to me that since this sleeve would be used around fire, a fire retardant material would have to be used. Also the issue of food possibly being dropped onto the sleeve when people are serving themselves made me think that the material would have to be machine washable too. After gathering all these products together I found someone to make a sample sleeve for me. The sample turned out very well and at this point I knew I had the material to make my pan warmer sleeve.
The Pan Warmer Sleeve
The sleeve blends in well with the wire rack and water pans giving a clean neat appearance.
The next step in this process was to find a sewing house willing to take on my project. I tried a couple of places locally and they were not interested in dealing with a new project that they did not know of and if it would be worth their time . I found a woman in town and she made my initial sleeve. I went on line and found Bespoke Stitchery LLC they are located in Orlando Florida, I sent them my sample sleeve and after much communication they were able to put a pattern together for me and developed my sleeve. They called it the Pan Warmer Sleeve and that name stuck with me and I am using it for this project. 
Bespoke Stitchery, Orlando Florida
The original racks I wanted to use were costly and as testing went on I discovered that the outer coating started peeling off after multiple uses.  I went on-line trying to find the exact size I was using but I could not. I remeasured the inside of the water pan and found a rack that was 18"X10" and nickle plated. This rack would fit the pan exactly and the nickle plating would handle the temperatures when in use. Then another problem showed itself, the 18"X10" rack sat a little higher than the previous rack so after measuring the new opening between the 2 pans  I contacted Bespoke Stitchery and explained the problem, they agreed to make a new pattern a 1/2" wider and the problem was solved.
The pan warmer sleeve is almost unnoticeable when you use it on the buffet.
Now I am ready to go forward with my plans to put my Pan Warmer Sleeve on the market.
Complete Pan Warmer Sleeve Kit
"Patent Pending"
This kit will consist of: 3 sleeves, 3 support racks, double drawstring bag to store your kit in and instructions of use and care . 
With the much needed donations I plan to:
1. Purchase the materials to make 300 sleeves or 100 kits.
2. Purchase the 300 support racks.
3. Purchase the large plastic double drawstring bags needed for storage of the kits.
4. Purchase the boxes to package the kit.
5. Pay for the advertisement page of the kit.
6. Pay for the licenses and registrations needed to put this product on the market.
7. Pay for the marketing aspect of this project.
8. To acquire the shipping packaging  for the kits and satisfy the backer rewards. 
I could have never gotten this far with my project without the support of my husband Dana Rhodes. His believing in me and his encouragement kept me going when I was bumping my head against the wall trying to figure this all out.  I would like to thank my cousin Wendell Napier for the photography and the video, his patience was unmeasureable and I so appreciate his help. I would like to thank my step daughter Danéa Rhodes for her marketing skills, the logo making and the countless hours we put in bringing this project together.

Cost effective shipping of my product is requiring a great deal of thought, planning and organizing through choosing the shipping outlet, via Post Office or UPS as well as packaging materials needed to ship. I am a bit nervous about getting out there and saying, see me and what I have created. One way of getting this information out there is through the internet advertising and social media although in this area I am not very savvy, I am confident that with the help of my marketing manager we will handle this aspect of our project. We are giving our all to this project and with your help we know we will be successful. 

The risk I would say is the unknown of this type of business, although I do run a successful part time concession trailer “Lisa’s Place”, which I started with no prior experience. So again I am confident because of my experience and my drive to be successful, that I will meet the challenges of this venture and have high expectations that all will go well.

Our current project is a food cart, Seconds by Jane Elaine, offering a throwback to childhood family meals in the form of the Sloppy Joe. Our homemade sandwiches are made with local, 100% grassfed bison from local farms-- a healthy alternative to traditional ground beef. 
Bison eating grass at Grassroots Bison Ranch in New Paris, OH
Bison contains about half the calories and just a fraction of the fat of beef. Grassfed bison is rich in iron, vitamin B-12 and omega-3 fats. We also offer a completely vegetarian version made with non-GMO soy protein, and none of our sloppies contain high fructose corn syrup (found in ready-made sloppy joe sauce.) We source local vendors and small businesses whenever possible because we love Ohio, Columbus, and the people who live here.
Annie and Dale Thompson of Grassroots Bison Ranch
We set up outside Ohio Tap Room in Grandview: a great local business selling only local products!
