No need to buy a pair of compression shorts or a jock strap ever again!  We have created the ultimate pair of athletic underwear for youths through adults.  Our product is so unique that we have a patent pending on it. Looks like regular underwear on the outside with our innovative technology on the inside. 
Jockster is the most innovative product on the market today. Guaranteed to put the confidence back into your step during work, play and extracurriculars... all day, every day, every man, everywhere. Go get ’em boys! Set the world on fire!
Bad relationships happen to good people. It’s not you, it’s them...seriously.  They are so complicated. One minute everything feels all smooth and cozy, the next they’re all up in your business.  You feel suffocated or the opposite—totally unsupported... At the very worst, they cause major destruction in your life.
The only choices up till now for men to find an effective support system are not up to par. Shopping for one is like dating a girl with a questionable reputation; you may have some fun together, but nothing you want touching your goods every day. 
The jockstrap: Nothing but a bunch of a-words: the most archaic, awkward apparatus. Invented in 1874, this...uhhh...whatever it is...hasn’t evolved much. While it may do the job, it twists and rides up into places that the sun doesn’t shine and...let’s be honest...it’s a little embarrassing to be caught with one (just like that questionable girlfriend). The only reason 20 or more companies continue to produce the jockstrap is because they are the most supportive product that currently exists. Sad story.
Compression shorts: This devil contraption was created as an alternative to the jockstrap with many style options. However, they are soooo tight in all the wrong places. I don’t think shoving my package into a saran-wrap-like fabric and feeling like a stuffed sausage is the best idea for support.
We deserve better. It’s time to evolve. The answer, my friends, is the Jockster. The first comfortable, flattering and effective support system!
Will be available for youth and adult, black boxer brief style. Youth size S, M, L, XL & Adult S, M, L, XL, XXL. With your help we can expand our inventory! Our goal is to quickly start producing additional colors & styles.We’ve got to protect our boys!
The Jockster is one piece, one waistband with the comfort and style you desire in everyday use with the functional components to stay put and be supportive while exercising. No more bunching, twisting, pinching, uncomfortable straps riding up underneath your underwear. No more tightness in all the wrong places. No more embarrassing moments stopping to adjust.
Our Story Tom Ziehler is just a typical guy... successful in life and in business, coaches a youth sports team and lives an active lifestyle. His days could get intense and he realized he was lacking a solid support system. After experimenting for years with all kinds of shapes and sizes, different characteristics, personalities, styles and colors but he was just unable to find “the one.” Tom began to build his own perfect combination of support, comfort, style and functionality into an all-in-one solution to his underwear problem. Thus, the Jockster was born.
Goal - Why we need Kickstarter Stop buying athletic shorts that don’t work and start supporting your business—by supporting this project. By doing so you are making a difference in men’s lives everywhere. Men have suffered long enough! Life is tough enough, humankind has no idea what a man who feels fully supported can do; there is no stopping that man. Feel the support! Feel the love! Lets evolve! #Jockster #GetItOn Let’s work together to make Jockster a reality—I believe in this product and have personally funded it up to this point. I’ve spent a year developing the product from fabric types to measurements. The patent for the Jockster is pending, and I’ve got a company that is ready to produce and get it to the marketplace. I need to raise the money to place the first large production order and help get the Jockster out into the world. I can’t do this without you.  
Share the support! Share the love! Let's evolve! #Jockster #GetItOn

What is it?
Smart phones are great, but you can't beat the charm of a vintage rotary phone with actual metal gongs for the ringer.  The doorbell phone rings any analog phone with the push of the wireless doorbell button. 
Why Do I Need It?
Rotary phones are amazingly beautiful!  The Doorbell Phone makes these amazingly designs useful again.  Here are just a few examples of what you can get on Etsy right now. (used with permission, more info here)
PLAY

How Does it Work?
You just hook the system up to your phone or the phone we provide for you.
The system consists of:
1.  A wireless doorbell button
2.  A doorbell module
3.  A power adapter
4. (multi-button packages only) a second wireless doorbell button
5. (complete packages only) a vintage style rotary phone
The doorbell button is battery powered, so there is no wiring required at the door.  The doorbell phone module plugs directly into a standard power outlet.  Plug the phone into the standard US phone jack on the module and your phone will ring whenever the doorbell button is pressed.  If you don't have a phone we can provide a brand new vintage style rotary phone as part of our Complete Doorbell Phone Package.
Need a doorbell on more than one door?  Our multi-button packages ring a single phone with two wireless buttons.  One button rings a standard US ring, while the other rings with a standard UK ring.  A simple and fun way to tell which doorbell is ringing.
Basic Package Features (Doorbell Module, you provide the phone)
Long range battery powered button
Adhesive or screw button mounting
High voltage for loud ring
Receiver off hook mute function
Plug and play, no modification required
Small and discrete module
Complete Package Feature (Complete Doorbell Phone Package)
Everything from the Doorbell Module
Brand new vintage style rotary phone included
Mechanical ring for authentic vintage sound
Product Features (Pocket Protector)
State of the art pocket protection technology
Space age polymer construction
The Robomotive Laboratories logo emblazoned on the unit

Turn any wired analog phone into a wireless doorbell. Just mount the battery powered button, plug your phone into the module, and plug the module into the wall.  Both buttons ring one phone.  One button rings a standard US ring, the other a standard UK ring.

Everything you need for your own Doorbell Phone, including a brand new vintage style rotary phone.  Phone is available in black, red, pink, and ivory.
Includes:

The Multi-Button Complete Package
Everything you need for your own Doorbell Phone, including a brand new vintage style rotary phone.  Both buttons ring one phone.  One button rings a standard US ring, the other a standard UK ring.Phone is available in black, red, pink, and ivory.
Includes:
1.  Doorbell phone module
2.  TWO Doorbell buttons
3.  Power adapter
4.  Vintage style rotary phone
Design
As with all Robomotive designs, the Doorbell Phone has simplicity of operation as the primary design objective.  The doorbell phone uses a wireless transmitter button, which is the only operator interface.  The button transmits to a receiver in the module.  The receiver signal is sent to an Adafruit Trinket, which sets the ringer and commands the phone ringer circuitry.  Analog phones operate on 35 to 70 volts DC, so bulk of the circuitry is involved in stepping up the 6V input voltage to something the phone can use.  The ringer frequency and duration is determined by the software in the Trinket, so if so inclined the savvy owner could change the ring to suit their preference.  For instance, we've had it ring using a UK standard ring in the past. 
What's done
All development costs have already been funded.  The prototype doorbell phone is currently working as the only doorbell in my house (Trick-or-Treat was fun!).  This unit uses all the same electronic components as the production unit, but on a prototype PCB.  The production PCB design is about 50% complete.  The unit is currently in a prototype enclosure, which is tucked away out of sight in my installation.  The production version will retain this small and easily hidden design.  The video above shows the actual installation in my home.  The Multi-Button versions are a little behind the others, and will be shipping slightly later.
What's left to do
Finish design of the production PCB and have units made. We also need to finish enclosure design, which will be 3d printed plastic until injection molding tooling is made.  All of these items will be complete prior to the end of this campaign.
Funding
Remaining funding requirements for this project are relatively modest, and mostly consist of volume pricing for components. A 3d printer is also planned for the early component cases, most of the cost of which will be funded from other sources.
Gift Giving
Clearly we won't be shipping by Christmas or Chanukah, but you can still give the Doorbell Phone as a gift.  If funding is successful early enough we can send a printed gift card on request.  If we go down to the wire we can send the card digitally.  Here's our draft graphic below:

I spent most of 2012 writing and revising the script that eventually became “Dusk.” As the story was finalized, Ryan Lewis created a budget that would allow the script to be filmed as written.
As this was our first feature, we were confident that we could turn this script into a film we would be extremely proud of, but decided to only raise the funds to create the film in its entirety – and then turn to Kickstarter to raise the money to take the finished film out into the world.
With the help of a dedicated crew and an unbelievably talented cast, I can say that two years later I am thrilled with what we created together…and now we need your help.
Your contribution will allow us to submit “Dusk” to over 90 film festivals worldwide and hopefully we will be invited to screen at a number of these same festivals. It will also let us compensate the professionals hired to create a final file that is optimized for a theatrical experience, using 4K video and 5.1 surround sound. This will allow the film to be viewed at the highest quality possible and hopefully open the door to a distribution deal, allowing the film to be seen by a wide audience.
We realize that there are a huge number of projects available on Kickstarter, but we truly appreciate you taking the time to consider “Dusk.” Please support our project in any way you can…every little bit helps. And it would mean the world to me if you could help spread the word about our campaign on social media.
#duskfilm
www.facebook.com/duskthefilm
www.twitter.com/duskfilm
Thank you so much…I could never have imagined the journey that “Dusk” would have taken us on so far, and I can’t wait to see where it will go next.
Sincerely,
Michael Maney
John Whitmore wakes to find himself in the midst of a real-life nightmare. His wife, Anne, disappeared from their bed overnight and a recorded ransom message now remains in her place. This mysterious recording instructs Whitmore to contact a man named David who will escort John to a cabin deep within the woods, where he will be reunited with Anne – in exchange for his life savings.
While riding in David’s rusted RV, Whitmore attempts to piece together the events of the previous evening, but instead, he begins to question the entire situation.
Told through fragments of the past that shatter the present, “Dusk” explores the darkest recesses of the mind as John attempts to survive a night of chaos, deceit and paranoia.

John McGlothlin (John Whitmore) - Born in the suburbs of Detroit and raised in South Florida, John studied at the University of Colorado before returning to Miami to begin his acting career. He started with critically praised turns in local theater productions before moving on to short films; one of the projects included working with “Dusk” co-star Juliana Harkavy. McGlothlin has since expanded into feature films, including leading roles in the campy horror film “Girls Gone Dead” and the romantic comedy “Taste It.” Currently residing in Los Angeles, John has also appeared on ABC's “General Hospital” and in several national commercial spots.
Ford D'Aprix
Ford D’Aprix (David/Producer) - After pursuing business and finance in college, Ford spent a year in the modeling field, traveling the world representing Versace, Calvin Klein, Perry Ellis and Ralph Lauren. Upon returning to the States, D’Aprix appeared in dozens of plays and produced and starred in a one-man off-Broadway production entitled “To Bury Caesar.” He also acted in several film and television projects, including 2011’s re-boot of “Charlie’s Angels.” Ford has also served as producer and creator on the documentary series “Think About It” as well as a feature length documentary entitled “Maestro.”
Juliana Harkavy

He appeared in films such as “Burn After Reading,” “Good Sharma” and Ridley Scott's “Someone to Watch Over Me.” Kidd’s numerous TV appearances include “Law & Order SVU,” “30 Rock” and “Late Night with Conan O'Brien.” On Broadway, he appeared in “The Will Rogers Follies,” and was involved with several First National Tour companies as an actor, stage manager and company tutor. Off-Broadway, he logged several years in the original Sullivan Street Playhouse production of “The Fantasticks.”
Michael Maney (Producer/Writer/Director/Editor) – Michael discovered filmmaking while in grade school and began creating action films with his friends and a very large VHS camera.His professional career began after a local production company discovered one of his high school short films in 1996.Maney has produced spots for Visa, Procter & Gamble and Simon & Schuster and his work has been seen onNBC, CBS, FOX, Comedy Central and Syfy.In 2010, Michael wrote and directed the award-winning short film Meth and his work has been mentioned in “Film Threat,” “Ain’t It Cool News” and “Cincinnati Magazine.”
Ryan Lewis (Producer/Director Of Photography) – Ryan has more than 16 years of experience working in commercial, film and television production.As the founder of Cider Mill Productions and one half of Dog Day Films, Lewis has firmly established his reputation for creating clever and engaging films.To date, Lewis' work has received more than 30 awards from film festivals nationwide and has been mentioned in “Time,” “The Onion,” “The Guardian,” “Ain’t It Cool News,” “Entertainment Weekly” and featured on the Independent Film Channel.
Jonathan Brennan (Music Composer) – Jonathan has an MFA in Music Composition for the Screen from Columbia College Chicago.At Columbia Jonathan studied with Disney’s former Vice President of Music Production Andy Hill, and veteran film composers, Gary Chang, Hummie Mann and David McHugh.He also conducted his thesis film score with a Hollywood orchestra at Capitol Records.Brennan’s music has been featured in award-winning independent films and he has written music for national brands including GE Aviation, Mentos, Airheads and ConAgra.

We’ve already completed a huge portion of the work. WE MADE A FEATURE FILM. Actually, we made a film that we absolutely love. We’re finished writing, shooting and editing…everything we had hoped for is on the screen. Now we just need to get it out into the world. 

At this point, the main variable for “Dusk” is how we’ll ultimately distribute the film. No matter what form of distribution (commercial distribution by a company – or self-distribution) “Dusk” finds, you will still receive the same rewards, but the timetable for delivery may vary depending on who is distributing the film. (i.e., we can’t send out DVDs of the film until the film is officially released, either by that company or by ourselves). We promise to keep all backers updated on the film’s progress with as much info as we have on distribution. 

By joining this Kickstarter campaign, you become part of the “Dusk” team. We can’t thank you enough for your support—and we want to make sure you know exactly what is happening with the film, so we will make sure to keep you in the loop.

As we try to acquire the best distribution for the film, please realize that every film goes along its own path. Some are released quickly…some take their time. There’s no real guideline to follow as every film is different. We’re attempting to find the best venue in order to get the film out to the widest audience possible, and finding that perfect balance can take time. We’re extremely proud of the work and we want everyone to see it…and we’d love it if you became part of the team pushing this film out to the world.

campaign.story:
What are Versa Bricks™?
Versa Bricks™ are toy construction bricks that allow you to connect LEGO® type bricks to Hot Wheels® tracks, K'NEX® building systems and HO scale train tracks.  There are currently six fully designed and tested bricks.  They work great and really allow you to "free your mind" and come up with all kinds of fun creations, expand your creativity and get more fun time out of your toys!  We need your Kickstarter support so we can build plastic injection molds for the six new bricks.  Then we can bring Versa Bricks™ to the masses!
http://prlink.toledoblade.com/Whitehouse-Ohio-family-brings-their-new-toy-project-to-Kickstartercom,243
Here's a look at all six bricks!!!
 Where did the Versa Brick™ idea come from?
The Versa Brick™ idea came to me way back in 1973 when I was a kid playing with my LEGO® and Hot Wheels® tracks.  Once you build everything you can per the instructions, you start to get creative!  Make the tracks go through the LEGO® buildings and trying to use LEGO® to support ramps, the ideas are endless!  But the problems are too!  Nothing seemed to hold up.  I always thought there should be a way these toys could be used together, I could picture it in my mind, I could sketch it, but just couldn't make the parts!
Later in life I now have my own kids and they face the same challenges with these toys that I did.  Then I remembered my ideas from back in '73.  But today I have an engineering degree, 3D solid modeling software, 3D printers and most of all Kickstarter!
Finally Versa Bricks™ can become reality!
What have we done so far?
Created 3D solid models for six new brick designs
Made prototypes from ABS material using 3D printer 
Tested for fit and function
Applied for patents, Versa Bricks™ are now Patent Pending
Determined tooling and productions costs
Created a project plan & timeline

Why do we need Kickstarter?
The next step is to invest in plastic injection mold tooling which will allow us to mass produce Versa Bricks™ at a competitive price. We need your support and in return you can get your very own Versa Bricks™ and the "warm and fuzzy feeling" that comes from supporting a great project.  Kickstarter will allow us to fund the plastic injection mold tooling for all the Versa Bricks™, fill the orders and give us the means to move forward!
What's the Project's Timeline?

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've done our homework to get to this point of the project. Some of the major tasks completed to date include:

- 3D solid models for the six new bricks
- made prototypes using a high end 3D printer
- tested by real kids
- tweaked the designs as needed
- established quality requirements
- applied for patent protection
- qualified sources for tooling and production parts
- established an overall project plan and time line

Through all this, the biggest challenge will be getting the tooling just right! 

I have extensive experience in tool design and manufacturing. I know that bricks seem simple to make but they are actually very precise components that must be manufactured to very tight tolerances in order for them to easily snap together, hold and be able to taken apart by little hands. 

With this in mind there is a risk of manufacturing delay if the first samples made from the production tooling do not meet the strict quality requirements. It is not uncommon for minor tooling changes to be needed in order to get the first production parts just right. 

We have the talent and experience to overcome these types of challenges.

Hello Friends,
We are The Speedbumps! A five piece Indie Folk band from Northeast Ohio. We’ve written a lot of new songs and are ready to get back into the studio to record our fourth full length album!
We appreciate all of you who have supported us throughout the years & we hope to have you guys along for this new album.
This time around we’re doing things a little differently. We’re humbly asking for your help to make recording this album possible. 
Being an independent band means we don’t have a record label who pays for all of the costs associated with making an album. But that also means that we’re able to create the kind of albums that we want to make without having to conform our songs to whatever the label tells us to.
The money that you give to this project will be used to cover costs of: Studio, Producer, Engineer, Mixing, Mastering, Album Artwork, CD Manufacturing, Packaging, Photographer, Poster Design & Manufacturing, Shipping, Kickstarter Fees. etc. 
If we’re fortunate enough to go over the goal.. ALL of the additional money will be used on marketing for the album. That includes Publicity, Music Videos, Radio, Contests, Touring, etc. 
All of these things will help The Speedbumps music reach more people. More listeners means more fans, and more fans means more touring! Those of you who have met us on tour know that we LOVE playing shows, and we hope this new album will take us to a point where we can tour full time!
In exchange for your help funding the album we’ve created some pretty cool rewards… Theres usual things like CD’s, T-Shirts, and Posters… and unique rewards like signed handwritten lyrics, postcards from the road, and disposable cameras stocked with exclusive behind the scenes pictures. You can check them all out along the right hand side of the page.
We only have 30 days to meet our goal, if we succeed we will record the album this Fall and release it in Spring of 2015.
However Kickstarter is ALL OR NOTHING… If the project is not 100% funded by the deadline, we will not receive any of the money pledged, none of the rewards will be fulfilled, and the new music we’ve written may not make its way to your ears… and we love nothing more than making people’s ears smile. 
Thank you all so much for your support!

campaign.story: You have all the benefits of a regular grill, so you aren't compromising. But unlike regular grills, this one can cook pizza without burning it, or more commonly, overcooking other areas, while undercooking areas. for example: Most grills will cook the crust of the pizza, but what it fails to do is cook the toppings correctly like the sauce that acts as an insulator and is the most difficult part of the pizza to evenly cook. Also the pizza cooks differently depending on the toppings. A pepperoni will produce oil which speeds up the cooking process. Another example would be having loaded the pizza with every topping you can think of, and they all act like insulators preventing the cheese as well as the other topping from cooking correctly with a normal grill. The only solution for a normal grill would be to cook it longer. But time and time again people try to cook everything through and end up burning the crust. Because simply with a normal grill, you can not cook toppings through without burning the crust. This grill is designed to be able to cook everything a normal grill can, except it funnels heat up and keeps it suspended. Rather than having exhaust ports that normal grills have to prevent over-heating. I might coin a phrase here, but we use our "pizza technology" to achieve this result. This grill is a mobile oven that cooks with the delicious flavor and efficiency, like no other!

campaign.story:
Wouldn't it be great if you could play all your favorite arcade games in a real arcade machine in your gameroom?  Well now you can!  Introducing the all new Game Gate: Gameroom Edition. 
Still with me?  Good, then lets talk potatoes and meat.  This isn't your grandmother's arcade machine or some cheap furniture with a home game console inside.  Game Gate represents huge leaps forward in how games are played.  Originally designed to be coin-operated, this amazing machine is being upgraded to GAMEROOM EDITION. This campaign is all about adding a revolutionary arcade panel and tweaking the system for free play, and at a price only available to those willing to help us launch through Kickstarter!
So let’s talk for a minute about the new arcade panel. There’s a lot of buttons and joysticks on today’s handheld controllers. The Game Gate commercial quality arcade panel has you covered. Each player features a classic style 8-way D-stick, 10 analog arcade buttons (they still click and function as digital and analog), and an analog joystick. All of this is mounted to a reverse printed Lexan panel that is scratch and spill resistant. We have also added a 4-way ball style joystick for those wanting an authentic classic experience on games like Galaga, Pac-Man, and Dig Dug that work best without diagonal movements. This is a great control panel and will work with Xbox 360 or PC. Check out our single player version if you want a similar feel without the cabinet.
So what is a Game Gate?
Game Gate is way more than an Xbox 360 in a cabinet.  As mentioned, the machines were the world's first and only licensed for public use home console based arcade.  The Xbox game console is controlled by a custom developed control board that switches video between an integrated PC and the game console.  Power and USB functions are directly controlled by the system, and game play is in a charge-by-time configuration.  Time remaining and custom messages are displayed in the LED matrix housed in the backlit marquee.  Color changing LEDs on the sides and front of the cabinet change to attract players.  A powerful sound system with ear level speakers and a powered subwoofer make any game sound incredible, and the games look stunning on the 32” LCD.  There’s a ton of extra features on the machine that make it very unique.  There are two headphone jacks on the front of the machine with separate volume control.  There are illuminated pushbuttons for player selection and system reset.  There is a video out on the back of the machine so you can use a shadow monitor (so if you have big screen TV in your gameroom, hook it up to the Game Gate and play from either screen).  There are casters on the bottom of the machine for easy moving and leg levelers for stable play.  
"The list goes on and on... no other universal arcade touches it."
If you are the tech savy/maker type and want to do some tweaks, it is quite easy to modify the system to run emulators and front ends such as Hyperspin on the onboard PC. Imagine customizing the LED matrix to display the game titles, creating your own front end, etc.  Definitely consider the standard editon here, because you won't need the XBox 360. 
If you have ever wanted to spice up your game room, the new Game Gate: Gameroom Edition is a guaranteed winner. The ability to play classic and newer generation games means there is always a game someone will love. So enough reading already, spread the word, pledge if you can, and GAME ON! Seriously, your dream gameroom just called and wants this for Christmas.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The project involves pulling together a labor force for the final assembly, integration, and testing. We have over 100 of the (unmodified) machines brand new, sealed and in a box. We plan to open every unit and thoroughly test and review every part before and after we make the modifications. We do make the components and electronics, so we are equipped to replace any component that is not 100% (and provide service or replacement parts for any unit that we ship). The biggest challenge for us is to fulfill all the orders as quickly as possible because we are eager to launch another campaign for a new product we have been working on for over a year. 
We fabricate the single player control panels by hand, including the thermo-formed base. These units take hours of painstaking attention to detail to build, and we only have a few people qualified for the work. If we sell a lot of them (and hopefully we do!), it could take a few months to fulfill all the orders. Also, we do have a limited inventory on hand of the circuit boards that connect the joysticks/buttons to the game console. If we have a demand beyond several hundred units, we will need to do another production run of the boards to complete the orders. This could add up to 12 weeks from the day we place our order to completing the product. We promise to advise backers before the end of the campaign if pre-sales are beyond our current inventory and any schedule impacts. Our goal is to fulfill the entire campaign well before Christmas, if that is on your mind.

Missed the Kickstarter? Want to still get a Beluga Razor & Save? 
Just head over to www.belugashave.com and Pre-Order Today!
PRESS WALL:
翻訳をありがとうGIGAZINE。
           Independent Razor Review
Independent Razor Review
Basically, if you want a better quality shaving experience, want to save money, and help save the planet (the blades can be recycled! No waste!). Then this razor sounds like it’s for you.
*NEW VIDEO* Beluga Razor in action + comparison (Please excuse the low-quality)
*NEW IMAGE* Comparison of Beluga Razor and DE razor
By using an innovative and open design, the Beluga Razor stands alone when compared with others:
A SINGLE EXPOSED EDGE
A Professional’s preferred choice that is now available in a user friendly design for the first time ever with the patent pending Beluga Razor. Professional Barbers take years to gain the muscle memory to maintain the ideal cutting angle of a single edged razor, but with the Beluga you gain these years of experience instantly.
Most people don't realize the amazing experience of shaving with a single edge, mainly because of the large learning curve typically associated with them (unless they just aren't aware).  However, that all changes today, because the Beluga Razor virtually eliminates this learning curve, thanks to its pivoting neck, so you can shave with ease for the first time ever.  If you can use a Gillette Razor; you can use the Beluga Razor the same way.
Such a unique and open design saves you thousands of dollars in the long-term because of the use of substantially lower priced replacements blades of your choice that can cost as low as 10¢ per blade!
PREMIUM MATERIALS
HEAD/NECK: 
We use 316L Stainless Steel for your Beluga Razor so it is incredibly durable and heavily weighted for easy shaving, while also looking and feeling incredible when compared with other razors that now just look like cheap substitutes.  This steel requires zero maintenance, virtually forever, thanks to its high degree of corrosion resistance, so just enjoy.
HANDLE: 
With the Beluga Razor we designed our handle to be a little bit larger and longer than usual to provide a nice and relaxing shave, but still retain the versatility to use multiple hand positions with ease and greater comfort.  The handle material that was carefully selected is Linen Micarta. Linen Micarta is a premium plastic used by many premium knife handle makers because it is extremely durable and actually creates a better grip when wet. Known as the "Cadillac of Plastics", the feel of this handle is truly unique, and just like the razor, it must be used to truly appreciate. The feel is warm and organic, and overtime it will even darken with age to represent the generations of use you will get out of it.  Each colored batch of Micarta is unique and will vary overtime, making your razor truly unique.  The handle colors available are Tuxedo Black, Hunter Green, and Bourbon Burgundy (aka maroon).
PIVOTING NECK: 
A pivoting neck is a simple and easy solution to make single edge shaving incredibly easy for the first time.  With the Beluga Razor we wanted your razor to have a high degree of pivot, but we recognized from the beginning that the pivot point would be the weakest feature. Accordingly, we spent a lot of time to make it one of the strongest features possible so it can help you reach those hard to reach areas and eliminate excessive pressure.
MAGNET:
We at Beluga recognized the ability to achieve a better quality shave with a single edge, but we wanted to make sure your entire experience with our razor was easy and safe when in use.  Accordingly, we recognized early on that picking up a thin razor blade from your counter was extremely hard, thus we added a magnet to easily pick up a razor blade from a flat surface to keep you safe and make things that much easier!
CUSTOMIZE YOUR SHAVE + SAVE 
Which will you choose?
Beluga is simply interested in providing you the best shaving tool, and not charging you an arm and leg for proprietary razor blades. For the first time you now have the ability to choose from 70+ different double edge blades available from manufacturers all over the world. They differ in metal composition, blade sharpness, and even the type of low friction coating applied, if any.  This allows you to find the perfect blade that best suits your skin and budget. Just look at how much you can save in the long-run below!  #expectmore
Double edge razor blades are the lowest priced blades in the world, thanks to their ease of manufacturing and standardized form.  Costing as little at 10¢ each, this allows you to pay back the Beluga Razor in less than two and half years.  When have you ever had a razor that pays for itself!  This means you can save over a thousand dollars in the long run!  These blades generally last for 3-7 shaves on your face (depending on how thick your hair is), but last far longer for shaving your body where the hair is thinner and your skin is tougher.
60 Day Return Policy!
IF YOU DON'T LIKE IT WHEN YOU GET IT...RETURN IT! Typically Kickstarter campaigns do not have return policies, but we at Beluga felt it was worth it to provide a low risk way to try a truly unique shaving experience. Accordingly, we created a 60 day, no-questions-asked return policy starting on the day you receive the razor. However, your razor must be returned in like-new condition and any dents, excessive wear, or other damage will cause your product not to be allowed to be returned. 
NOTE: You can only ask for a refund AFTER receiving the product in the mail and you will have to pay for shipping back to us (the razor is very small and light so it's not that much).  For full details on the return process go to http://www.belugashave.com/terms-and-conditions/
NO CLOGGED OR DIRTY RAZOR ANYMORE
 The Beluga Razor is designed to easily remove any and all hair with a simple rinse.  Additionally, because it is made from 316L Stainless Steel, you can easily clean the razor with ease.  Who designs a razor that gets clogged everytime?  That's just annoying.
GREENEST PIVOTING RAZOR ON THE PLANET!
All pivoting razors currently on the market rely on cheap, plastic cartridge blades that have to be thrown into the garbage and cannot be recycled since they are a mix of plastic and metal that are too small and labor intensive to disassemble. This leads to hundreds of millions being thrown out every month!  With the Beluga Razor, you can recycle your double edge razor blades since they are pure metal. Additionally, since our razor was built to last, there should practically be zero waste.  This makes the Beluga Razor the greenest pivoting razor on the planet! (See our FAQ about how to recycle razor blades) #expectmore
Hold up, you mean to tell me that not only will the Beluga Razor give me a better quality shave, but it will also save me a considerable amount of money even compared to so called low cost competitors?  AND I can help the planet at the same time?  YES, now you are getting it!  We hope you are excited about this product just as much as we are to bring it to you!
25 YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY
We wanted to ensure that when you purchase the Beluga Razor that you are as confident about the quality of our razor as we are.  So we provided a 25 year guarantee to ensure you never need worry.  Either way, everything on the Beluga Razor is easily repaired or replaced.  For more specific information please view the "Legal" page on our website at www.belugashave.com.
HOW IT WORKS
We are working on making the Beluga Razor as easy and safe to use as possible to ensure you are confident when using it.  You just:
1. OPEN UP THE HEAD 
2. INSERT ANY DOUBLE EDGE BLADE
 3. LOCK IT DOWN 
Currently, we are using a brass thumbscrew that you twist on, but we are working on several more user friendly designs we know you will appreciate!
PATENT PENDING
When we first conceived the idea for the Beluga Razor, we knew we had hit upon something truly unique.  Accordingly, we are seeking patent protection worldwide to ensure a standard and high quality product is delivered to your door
WEIGHTED HEAD
We found that placing more weight into the head of our pivoting razor is where the experience of the shave really improved since one does not feel the need to press any harder since they can simply let the head do the work. This takes a lot of stress both out of your hands and your face and allows for a more comfortable shaving experience.  If you are a hardcore DE user, trust us, we were just as skeptical as you are (SHOUT OUT TO: badger&blade + wickededge)
DESIGNED TO BE SEEN
The Beluga Razor was designed from the beginning to be something that you can be proud to leave out and display. Most people hide their razor simply because they are ugly, cheap, or full of grime since they are difficult to clean. We want to be, and would be honored to be, the distinct voice in your bathroom that says you are unique, think for the long-term, and value quality without having to say anything at all.
TRAVEL FRIENDLY 
Even when on the go you want a high quality shave and with the Beluga Razor this is what you get. Many places all over the world generally don’t have replacement blades for some of the higher cost competitors like we have in America, but they generally do have a wide assortment of double edge razor blades that will work with the Beluga Razor. Thus, no matter where you travel you can be assured you will have a plentiful supply of blades to choose from.  Just be aware that double edge blades cannot be carried onto a plane and must be checked.
MADE IN USA
From the beginning we wanted to make this product in the USA with American companies and American workers.  Accordingly, we have reached out to many USA manufacturers who are eager to help us make a high quality product that can be quickly delivered to your door without the usual delays other crowdfunded products run into when sourcing from overseas.  
STRETCH GOALS 
More backers means more options and even free gifts! So please help spread the word in order to ensure you get all the options we have to offer!
$150,000 Stretch Goal Reward!
If we can get the campaign up to $150,000 in pre-orders than EVERY razor ordered will receive 5 free PREMIUM blades.  Just our way of saying thanks, and to make sure you can immediately use the razor when you get it.
$250,000 Stretch Goal Reward
                    FREE TRAVEL CASE
 We will reveal what the travel case looks like at $200,000, but it's really nicely designed and can store a pack of blades for travel.  Normally it would retail for $25.
OTHER STRETCH GOALS ARE FURTHER DOWN THE LINE.
PRODUCTION & DELIVERY PLAN
Here's a basic breakdown of our plan to get the Beluga Razor produced:
October - Finalizing form/dimensions, Sourcing Components, Finalizing Manufacturers, Developing Packaging
November - Finalizing form/dimensions, Sourcing Components, Finalizing Manufacturers, Developing Packaging
December - Finalizing form/dimensions, Develop Tooling Molds, Finalize Packaging
January - Refine Tooling Molds
February - Refine Tooling Molds
March - Test Runs on Tooling Molds
April - Final Test Runs and Final Approvals for Tooling Mold
May - Start Production, Assembly, and Packaging for Shipping.
June - Buffer Month, unlike others that expect things to go as scheduled, we want to plan on delays and thus included 2 buffer months.
July - Another Buffer Month and Shipping
WHO ARE WE YOU ASK?
Zac Wertz - The founder and CEO of Beluga Shave Co.  He is an Attorney with an MBA and background in Finance from Cincinnati, Ohio.  Taking a detailed oriented approach from his legal career and applying it toward designing the Beluga Razor.  He is creating a better shaving tool not only for you, but himself and he won't stop till he is absolutely sure when you open the box that your mind will be blown!
REST OF TEAM:
The rest of the team is made up of high level independent industrial designers and mechanical engineers that have been hand selected to be just as passionate as Zac is!  We just can't currently disclose who for confidentiality reasons.  We can share that the initial design and prototype was made with the help of the talented design team at Trident Designs (trident-design.com) in Columbus, Ohio!
ANYTHING I CAN DO TO HELP?
After you support us, we would love if you helped spread the word. Email, Facebook, Twitter - whatever you prefer!
We can be found on Facebook, Twitter, and at our homepage. Don't hesitate to reach out to us at info@belugashave.com.  We want to be as responsive as possible, but depending on the volume of people this obviously can pose some issues.  Still, we hate crowdfunding projects that are not responsive so we promise to be as responsive as possible to ensure you are satisfied. Responsive, haha.

updates.update_content:
Hey Backers, 
From our last update we talked about finalizing the design and getting re-quoted from various vendors to start production. In this update we plan on explaining what happened since that time, where we are now, and then finally give a detailed step by step plan towards production and ultimately shipment of your Beluga Razor. 
 The process for deciding on and locking down vendors took a bit longer than anticipated as we actually had to switch a few things around in regards to who we anticipated working with and where things were going to be made. We were finally able to engage with select vendors here in the United States that would best be able to hit our tolerances, speed to production, and price points for production. The most critical vendor selected was our Metal Injection Molding (MIM) vendor who would build the tooling and manufacture the critical metal parts that will precisely hold the blade. This one vendor’s timeline alone is what dictates the time to ship because it involves the creation of a tool from hardened steel that will be used in manufacturing the main critical metal parts of the Beluga Razor. Here is an image of the one of the tools for the neck in CAD form that has been confirmed and will be cut into a steel tool.

Hey Backers,
We recognize that we’ve been a little delayed in communicating what has been going on, thus we want to bring you up to speed with this update about us finalizing the design for production and progressing forward. In our last update we told you that we have locked in the blade position, but that we wanted to shrink the size of the head because the largeness was causing issues for some people when shaving in tight areas. This was a bit of a challenge to shrink this area, and as we were doing this our designer realized the potential for a vastly better latching mechanism (shown below) to replace the thumbscrew. It was so much better and straightforward that we decided to take the time to go through with the change since we were still shrinking the size of the head. In addition, we wanted to wait on sending out an update until we received the finalized metal prototypes with this design to confirm that this was the design we were going to go with. We didn’t want to add to any confusion with our direction just in case this design ended up not working.

Hey Backers,
We know it’s been a couple months since our last update and we wanted to explain why there has been a delay in communication, highlight our progress to date, and explain the next steps. 
In the last update we had just made approximately 8 prototypes for consumer testing. This took a while to perform because it was right during the holidays, but by January we were able to gather all the results.

Hey Backers, 
We just got in some new prototypes to do some larger scale shave testing to do final testing before production begins. Beluga has been taking part in a local hardware accelerator here In Cincinnati, Ohio called First Batch (www.firstbatch.org) and after achieving a more finalized design we have discussed with our advisors that it would be best to do a somewhat larger testing phase with a larger variety of unfamiliar users before running a production run. The shaving performance so far has exceeded our expectations for a smooth and close shave, but we just want to ensure this translates to a larger variety of unfamiliar users. Accordingly, we are creating 2 test batches of razors before completely finalizing the design and moving towards production that we have stated in our prior update will take approximately 20-22 weeks and thus initially pushes us until Q2 of 2016 to be able to ship the razors.

Hey Backers,
We have been doing extensive testing in plastic form to finalize the bottom surface of the head of the razor where the blade is exposed.  We are excited because we have found a form that has eliminated the nicking issue that some testers have been experiencing.  This took time because we had to work with the varied elasticity of the skin of different users.  Those with thicker skin never have had any real issues, thus we are primarily working with more sensitive skinned individuals to ensure we were completely confident before moving forward with a metal prototype version.  We are finalizing the current form in metal in 1-2 weeks to confirm these changes, but there could still be some slight adjustments/testing that we want to do to ensure absolute confidence in the design before production.  This could entail making 10-30 metal prototypes with subtle adjustments to the bottom surface, having a larger set of  25-50+ testers provide their feedback, and then evaluating the best bottom surface to lock in for production.

Hey Backers,
Right away we want to say that our push for a September shipment is not going to be feasible and we will have to delay until a to be determined shipment date.  A couple of things hindered our ability to reach this goal and we will also explain below why the shipment date is to be determined.
First, our prototype vendor incorrectly machined a critical area on one portion of the razor as we have stated before, and this led to an unacceptable shave.  We were the ones who selected this vendor, thus we will certainly take the blame.  However, this is not an ordinary prototype machine shop.  This machine shop specializes in very tight tolerances and complex geometry, and was why they were ultimately chosen.  Plus, they were the only ones to guarantee our tolerances versus just offering best efforts.  This resulted in them reworking the flawed parts for free, but we first had to figure out exactly what went wrong.  However, given the tight tolerances involved one cannot simply just measure the part using hand tools.  Rather, this required us to perform metrology on the part which involved laser scanning the surface in order to compare it with our CAD data to see where the metal parts were off.  Below is one of the laser scans for you to see (please note that we pixelated the critical area, but anything dark blue is way off).  The flawed area where the blade is exposed out the bottom resulted in the blade being distorted at the cutting edge and increasing the cutting angle beyond acceptable levels.

Hey Backers,
We got metal versions of the razor in last week, and the razor looks great so we wanted to share some images below of what the Beluga Razor looks like in metal form.  Unfortunately, there is an issue with the metal version that is leading to infrequent nicks/cuts that wasn't present in prior prototypes.  It shaves very well, but based on our prior shaving experience we can feel that something is off.  We believe the issue lies with the razor blade edge being distorted because of an error when CNC machining it, but when we are talking about subtle differences in microns it is hard to immediately measure and pin point the issue.  Accordingly, we are working with a Metrology company to laser scan the razor to see how and where it might deviate from our CAD data in order to pin point the issue.

Hey Backers,
We wanted to send out an update with a few of things we have just gotten in and quickly share these with you all.
Final Metal Verification (Coming Soon!)
We mentioned that the final metal verification razor will be coming in soon and we were able to get the vendor to supply a picture of it while it was in the machine a day ago.  This version is CNC machined via a high accuracy 5 axis machine, but the final production version will not be CNC machined like this.  The reason why it even took this long is because first the Beluga Razor has some very high tolerances making it difficult to even find a vendor who could meet them, and secondly every vendor has lead times of work already scheduled ahead of when they could even fit our razor in.

Hey Backers,
We wanted to update you on where we are at and also layout our revised timeline to give you a better perspective.  We have finalized the design, have created 2d prints and tolerance info for all the parts, and are working with our final select few vendors, most of whom we have been in discussion with since last year about this project.  As soon as final vendor selections and tolerances are finalized we can start setting up  for production.  Just be aware that after selecting the final vendors that there is still a long lead time for this stage, and this is the reason why we had to push shipping back until September.  This razor is a precision tool with very precise tolerances, and this just takes time to accomplish.

Hey Backers- 
We have several things to mention in this update, but the most important of which is that shipping is most likely going to be delayed by 2 months until September 2015. We know this is the last thing you want to hear and we will work hard to make this time up, but the reason for this delay is because we discovered that our design firm incorrectly modeled how the blade curved resulting in the incorrect blade angle being applied to the razor. We hoped to have a final design earlier, but this recent unplanned revelation ended up requiring the razor head to be redesigned because of this error. We have been delaying an update because of these issues so that we delivered you the final solution to this problem, and we are pretty excited with what we came up with both from a design and functional stand point. We actually think everything ended up for the better in all aspects with this redesign, except for the slight delay of course, to ensure you get the best razor and shave possible since the increased blade angle would have resulted in a harsher shave. Below are quick snapshots of the new razor design, and we hope to share images of this new design in metal form in a few weeks. Additionally, we hope to start providing more updates as we move closer to production now that we have everything in its final form.

"Promising to be one of the most exciting new folk collaborations of 2014, The Changing Room is a folk project driven by singer songwriter Tanya Brittain and vocalist and musician Sam Kelly, and together they conjure up magic."
Thank you for helping to make our debut album dreams a reality. We got together in July this year as a bit of an experiment and the result was a 3-track EP called A River Runs Between which you can check-out using the links below. All our music is original and the EP tracks feature guest performers Jennifer Crook on harp, Ryan Jones on guitar and backing vocals, and the atmospheric choruses of Polperro Fishermen’s Choir. 
We've been overwhelmed by fantastic feedback about the EP, so we're bursting to share more of our music with you. We've already written all the tracks for the album ... we just need to raise enough money to get into the studio! Thank you in advance for you support.
"The force behind The Changing Room is songwriter Tanya Brittain, who manages to weave deeply evocative narrative around enchanting and addictive melodies. With a musical career spanning thirty years, Tanya brings a wealth of creative influences and performing experience, which is immediately apparent in the subject matter, depth and beauty of the songs on the EP. Singer, song-writer and multi-instrumentalist Sam Kelly hails from the depths of Norfolk. Sam’s link to folk music is in the Gaelic folk songs that his Irish grandfather would teach him to sing as a child. Although many individual songs and tunes have been lost in the blur of childhood memory, Sam has never lost the love and child-like awe for the beautiful sounds of traditional music, and this passion pours out of him in every note he sings."
Tanya Brittain - The Changing Room
“Sam has such a beautiful voice and sings with so much soul. I’ve seen him perform live a few times and he’s amazing…he’s so talented” Cara Dillon
“A captivating performer, Sam Kelly has one of the best young male voices in British acoustic roots music. Seriously … check him out!” Sean Lakeman
Sam Kelly - The Changing Room
SO WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM OUR DEBUT ALBUM?
More original folk music, real instruments, interesting arrangements, and spine tingling vocal performances. We've secured the ongoing involvement of top producers Boo Hewerdine and Jon Kelly for the album, both of whom worked with us on the EP tracks. 
Boo said“I met Tanya at a songwriting retreat and she told me about her hopes for this project. It is thrilling to see it come to fruition and exceed expectations. The start of something very special.”
Jon Kelly has produced and mixed legendary albums for an incredible spectrum of artists including The Beautiful South, Heather Nova, Tori Amos, Paul McCartney, Deacon Blue, Prefab Sprout, Kate Bush and Paul Heaton’s solo album. He mixed the tracks on our EP and we're looking forward to working with him again in the album.
We had fantastic fun in the studio with the twenty-three members of Polperro Fishermen’s Choir who added their rousing choruses to two of our tracks. They can usually be found on the quayside in Polperro, Cornwall on Wednesday evenings throughout the summer and we hope they'll be joining us again for a couple of the album tracks.
The Changing Room
We created three music videos to accompany the tracks on the EP and had a tremendous response on YouTube. It's all been a bit of a fabulous whirlwind really! 
The video animation for Deep Beneath the Sea features artwork by artist Kirsty Elson. Kirsty, who lives in Cornwall, states her coastal surroundings as her inspiration and creates multi-media art using worn materials washed up on beaches. The three dimensional piece is the backdrop for our haunting tale of the power of the sea.
Kirsty Elson Art
Thank you again for coming with us on this very exciting journey. We look forward to sharing more of our music with you very soon.
Sam and Tanya x x 
Keep up to date with The Changing Room @ChangingRMusic and /thechangingroommusic or by joining our mailing list at www.thechangingroommusic.com.

campaign.story:
What is it?
The Mad Genius Controller is a split-apart universal gaming controller for use across all consoles and PCs:
PlayStation / PS2 / PS3 / PS4
XBOX / XBOX 360 / XBOX One
Windows PC
Nintendo
The controller uses a revolutionary new location tracking technology. A dedicated motion capture system enables each controller-half to know exactly where it is in the room. It uses this information to add motion play to unmodified consoles and PCs while preserving the use of standard buttons and sticks.
See some shotgun frenzied action in Titanfall!
Skyrim on First Generation Prototype
The Mad Genius Controller uses a new patented technology to know where you are down to 1/100th of an inch! Any move you make is accurately tracked. Other "motion" controls that use cameras and accelerometers don't have this accuracy and can't provide this level of motion play.
The Mad Genius Controller is designed to look and feel familiar to gamers. The controller acts as a traditional controller when it's together. When split, it adds high definition motion gaming. All buttons and sticks still work EVEN WHEN MOTION IS ACTIVE. Play with conventional buttons and sticks, motion, or even use both at the same time.

The Mad Genius Controller works out of the box with any title you buy or already own and with any console or PC.  It doesn't require modifications to the game software or to the console hardware.  It is not a “proof of concept” awaiting the development of new games. It needs no patches to work with existing PC titles. Choose a Game Profile to match your game and add precision motion.  It's that simple.
Is it wireless?
We have received several questions about the wires shown in the videos. The wires are there to provide power to the controller and carry traditional button presses back to the console. The controller shipped to backers will be 100% wireless. Wireless communications to a console is easy. We just do not have the space inside the current prototype to house batteries and our custom circuitry. Kickstarter funding will enable us to shrink our custom hardware to a chipset, freeing up the space to accommodate the batteries and the standard wireless modules.
It was important to us to demonstrate the unprecedented accuracy of the NEW technology, which is the absolute positioning system you have seen in the videos.
CES 2014

Why Would I want one?
You can use it with any game and console, even the ones you already own
No waiting on special titles to be developed for it
You can use this ONE controller on all your consoles
Its Ergonomic. When split apart the controller is much more comfortable than a traditional controller
It adds 1/100th of an inch precision aiming, pointing and moving to your game
Use motion for in-game actions such as reload, melee, open doors, pick things up and more
Your game character can move with you, walking, ducking and sidestepping right along with you
Program button combinations into an easily remembered motion
Final Version will be wireless
Works with head mounted displays
This one device gives you the features of a:
Standard Controller
Motion Controller
Steering Wheel
Flight Stick
Mod Enabled Controller
But takes up the space of a traditional controller!!
Did we say it works with all your existing games???
Oh - And we have AWESOME T-Shirts too!
How does it work?
The Absolute Positioning System
A dedicated motion capture system determines the absolute position of each half of the controller in 3D space in a 12ft by 15ft playing area
Determines acceleration and velocity based on changes in position
Tracks your motion with 1/100th of an inch (.25mm) accuracy with no drift.
Use it when standing, moving around or sitting on the couch
      No Hardware Modifications Needed
Plug the Mad Genius Controller into the standard console controller port with provided console adapters
Works plug and play with head mounted displays like Oculus, as well as desktop PCs
We have compiled a series of short explanation videos on our website that cover how the controller works in more detail. Check out the : Mad Genius Controllers Chapter Videos
The Profile Designer
A "Game Profile" customizes motions to match the game. The Profile Designer allows you to create, edit and share game profiles with the Mad Genius Controller online community. Don't like the motions we designed for your game? Change them. Don't see a design for your game? You can create one and share it.
The Profile Designer can be run locally on your PC / laptop or tablet, or via most browser enabled devices.
Use the Profile Designer to:
Download Game Profiles from the web community
Use Game Profiles as they are or change them to make them yours
Build new profiles from scratch and share with other players via the cloud
Follow authors of your favorite profiles and rate their profiles
The Mad Genius Controller gives you more than pin point aiming and motion control. Split the controller in half and it morphs into:
A Steering Wheel
A Flight Stick and Throttle
A Bow
A Horses Reigns
A Dragon’s Wings
A Sword and Shield
And so much more ...
Why Kickstarter?
We are a small team and we've taken the project as far as we can part time. The next step is to take the product to production. For that we need your help.
Our goal is to provide a high quality, well tested and durable product to you and that requires time and resources to do it right. The patented tracking technology is a completely new innovation.  It takes more resources to deliver something that hasn't been done before. That's why we're here.
Product Timelines - Our Journey So Far
Product Next Steps with Your Support

Will there be a Development Kit?
YES! Development Kits will be available!
The first is aimed at Game developers and game studios.  The second is for hobbyists who want to use the tracking technology in other applications.

Gamer Dev Kit:
We didn't want to bring you a device with only promises of the future and we didn't want to build a device that was limited to only the games of yesterday and today. The Gamer Dev Kit gives a developer access to every bit of tracking, velocity and acceleration data that the controller creates.  True one-to-one control between your hands and the game will be possible for swords, light sabers, moving objects, moving around, and anything else you can imagine.

Tech Dev Kit:
Many people have expressed an interest in the amazing accuracy of the Mad Genius Controller's location tracking technology for other, non-gaming applications. The Tech Dev Kit has been designed to satisfy the hobbyist and those wanting to explore what can be done with 1/100th of an inch location tracking. In addition to the controller and APIs you will also take delivery of additional tracking markers and all the info you need to get you started.

More details of both of these kits can be found on our website at:
- http://www.madgeniuscontrollers.com/devkits.aspx
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Mad Genius Controller uses new technology that has never before been brought to market. We have already overcome the challenges of transforming an idea of motion gaming into a working proof-of-concept design. We are confident that we can take this to the next level.

Mad Genius Controllers has a small capable team but we are by no means alone. We have built relationships with suppliers and manufacturers here in the USA as well as overseas in Hong Kong and Singapore. Their support enabled us to demonstrate at CES 2014 and has given us access to additional technology to make our first consumer prototype even better.

We are confident we have the right team to complete this project but there are always risks to manage:

• The prototype's hardware design will be cleaned up and miniaturized
• New software must be designed, written and tested
• Hardware components must be sourced while controlling costs
• Plastic components must be designed, fabricated and tested for comfort and usability
• The hardware and software responsible for (x,y,z) tracking will be engineered into a single chip
• A system must be set up for final assembly and quality testing of each unit
• A system must be established for Shipping and Receiving

We will update our supporters every step of the way. We will keep you informed of each challenge and how we overcame it. When you take delivery you won't just be among the first to own a Mad Genius Controller. You'll be part of its creation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Calling all haunt fans!  
We have 3 DAYS LEFT TO MAKE OUR GOAL, or Kickstarter's rule is that we get $0 and our backers get full refunds... 
If you liked the trailer, please pre-order your copy of HAUNTERS today - every dollar will go to making the movie even better! 
We have a lot of work ahead of us to finish the film and the final version will depend on making our Kickstarter goal... Director/Producer, Jon Schnitzer, hopes you share his vision to make HAUNTERS the best it can be:
HAUNTERS is a documentary for all you haunted house fans, who have to get your “scare-apy” this time of year!
A life-long fan of Halloween and all things horror, Jon Schnitzer (co-owner of The Brain Factory & HAUNTERS Director/Producer) was inspired to document the world of haunting as it becomes increasingly mainstream and spawns a whole new wave of extreme - sometimes controversial full-contact - entertainment.  And, he was curious to explore what is driving the boom in demand for the wild spectrum of interactive horror experiences that have proliferated in recent years.
Over the last year, we gained exclusive access to some of the most popular, theatrical and infamous haunts in America - like Universal Studios Halloween Horror Nights, Knott’s Scary Farm, Delusion, Blackout and McKamey Manor, to name just a few.  We also have shot hundreds of hours of behind-the-scenes and personal footage of a fascinating cast of characters, including professional and home-haunters, their families, the monsters and the fans who love them. 
If you're one of the >32 million Americans who will attend a haunted house this year, we know you will appreciate the passion and professionalism that have gone into making HAUNTERS The Movie!
Every dollar raised will help make HAUNTERS a better movie!
We’ve accomplished a lot with HAUNTERS so far, but we still have a lot of work ahead of us to finish the film… and we will have to make a lot of tough decisions where to cut corners if we don’t get some outside funding to help.  
If we don't make our Kickstarter campaign goal, all the pledges will be refunded to our backers and we will get $0.  Kickstarter's rule is all-or-nothing - scary!So, while we continue to devote our own resources and time to completing HAUNTERS by next fall, we hope you are inspired to kick in!
When you back HAUNTERS, you’ll be supporting must-have essentials to finish the film:
EDITING – Jon has had every intention from the start, to edit HAUNTERS himself. Everyone knows the real storytelling of cinema happens in the editing room and telling the haunters’ stories is what inspired him to make HAUNTERS in the first place. However, we will need to hire an assistant editor(s) to help organize and cut the hundreds of hours of footage that was shot over the last year, as well as to help compile and overlay all the footage/photos the haunters gave us rights to include.  Our goal is to finish HAUNTERS in time to submit to film festivals, so we can get the broadest exposure possible...
AUDIO – We are extremely lucky to have the score and the music for HAUNTERS already covered, and by some amazing talents. However, we will need to hire a Sound Engineer to level-out the footage audio, to match the caliber of our soundtrack. All the different locations we wanted to include in HAUNTERS ended up generating a lot of variability in the sound quality. And, as you can imagine, the sound tracks from recording inside the haunts will take some significant tweaking due to all the screaming...
ARCHIVAL FOOTAGE/IMAGES – We need rights to include some copyrighted footage/images that will help tell the story of how haunted houses have evolved over the years and highlight media coverage of the controversies some haunters have had to face, from protests to shut-downs...
VOICE OVER (VO) NARRATION – The storylines of HAUNTERS will be told by the haunters themselves, their families and fans. However, every documentary needs a great professional VO talent. We have VO options in mind, but the final choice will come down to who/what we can afford...
INTERVIEWS – We’re shooting HAUNTERS now (as you read this!) and will continue shooting into early 2015. It’s impossible to include every haunt, but we want to interview a few more cutting-edge haunters and experts to help shed light on why we love to scare and be scared, the therapeutic value of screaming your head off and the primal need for that rush of ‘survival’ adrenaline.  The final choices will come down to who/what we can afford in terms of travel and local equipment/crews...
HAUNTERS will premiere next Oct 2015, one way or another - the final version of the movie is up to you!  Plus, when you back HAUNTERS, you’ll get to choose from some great rewards (scroll down for pics).
We’ve accomplished a lot already, to make HAUNTERS a reality and we plan to premiere HAUNTERS in October 2015.
Over the last year, we invested a tremendous amount of our own resources and money on pre-production, production and some post-production - on the good faith that there’s an audience (*you*) who will share our passion for this movie.
We know it’s risky to try to raise funding on Kickstarter, but we don’t just see this as a way to help to cover the final costs to complete HAUNTERS. Making a documentary is crazy hard work and we are energized by others who share our passion!
Not only do we have hundreds of hours of footage of amazing scares, behind-the-scenes drama and in-depth personal interviews with some of the most popular and infamous haunters in the world, we are ecstatic to have an all-star soundtrack already locked-down.
Since soundscape is so important to the horror genre, we wanted HAUNTERS to deliver the caliber of cinematic audio experience we know fans will love:
Jonathan Snipes (Composer for ROOM 237) will compose an original score
Alexander Burke (Magnolia Memoir & Save Ferris) is our Music Supervisor
We have rights to use 2 songs by DEAD MAN’S BONES (written/performed by Ryan Gosling & Zach Shields)
A documentary soundtrack normally costs ~$100K+, so we are incredibly lucky to have this dream team already committed to HAUNTERS The Movie.   
Every dollar raised above our initial goal will go to making HAUNTERS even better:  
$30K STOP ANIMATION:  Many haunters shared heartwarming stories of how they got into haunting and we'd love to depict some of their origin stories in the most heartwarming way possible - stop animation!  We are lucky to have Pete Levin (Robot Chicken, etc) and Musa Brooker (Celebrity Death Match, etc) ready to jump on board. Pete says: “Haunts are handmade and are created out of passion that first began at childhood. which is why I’m excited to bring my stop animation skills to Haunters and bring a bit of whimsy, childhood innocence and my own handmade art to this incredibly visceral documentary."  
$20K MOTION GRAPHICS: Many haunters' have wild dreams of the future of haunting and we want to use motion graphics to create their vision on screen, rather than just have them talk about it.  And, it would be great to have some killer titles of course...  We have several options for graphics, it will come down to what we can afford.
$17K PROFESSIONAL COLORIST: All the different locations we wanted to include in HAUNTERS ended up generating a lot a variability in the video quality, so we'd ideally like to hire Juan Cabrera to take care of the coloring and make sure that HAUNTERS has a rich cinematic feel. Juan’s credits include Transformers: Age of Extinction, Beneath, Amazing Spiderman, Prometheus, Star Trek Into Darkness, etc. 
$? CELEBRITY NARRATOR: We have a short list of celebs we’d want to go after, if we could afford them. And, if we get to this level of fundraising on Kickstarter, we’ll have a LOT more options for sure because they’ll know they’re part of something that already has an audience of dedicated fans. 
All funds raised will be used to make HAUNTERS the best film it can be!    
Stop motion sequence by Pete Levin & Musa Brooker - so cool!
Some of the people in HAUNTERS The Movie

John Murdy (Universal Halloween Horror Nights Hollywood, Creative Director) // Lora Ivanova (Co-Owner, ScareLA) // Melissa Carbone (Ten Thirty One Productions Great Horror Campout & LA Haunted Hayride, Co-Founder/Creator) // Russ McKamey (McKamey Manor Creator & Co-Owner) // Justin Meyer (Ten Thirty One Productions) // Jason Blum (Blumhouse Productions, Director/Producer The Purge & Paranormal Activity & etc ) // Josh Randall (BLACKOUT, Co-Creator & Co-Owner) // Brooke Walters (Knott's Scary Farm, Supervsor of Design) // Larry Bones (Bone Yard Effects) // Jill Killington (aka Jill Kill, Horror Writer/Reviewer/Expert) // Bruce Stanton (Reign of Terror) // Shar Mayer (Professional Monster & Entertainer) // Donald Julson (Nightmare on Loganberry, Creator) // Ted Dougherty (Haunt Historian) // Johanna Atilano (Theme Park Adventure, Co-Owner & ScareLA, Co-Producer) // Eric Lowther (Haunted Overload) // Jon Braver (DELUSION, Creator) // Iris Markofsky (aka Shard, Sinister Pointe) // Preston & Dianne Meyer (Rotten Apple 907) // Chris Atkins (aka Twitchy, Sinister Pointe) // Carol Schultz (McKamey Manor, Co-Owner) // Dasha Kittredge (DELUSION, Actress) // Slash (Haunt Fan & Musician) // Chris Williams (Universal HHN Hollywood, Art Director) // Patrick Tatopoulos (Special FX Master & Creature Creator) // McKensie Westmore (SyFy's Face Off) // Brady MacDonald (LA Times, Theme Park Reviewer) // Rick West (Theme Park Adventure, Co-Owner & ScareLA, Co-Producer) // Brian Kinsman (DIY Haunts, Creator/Owner) // Clay Stevens (Home Haunter) // Kristjan Thor (BLACKOUT, Co-Creator) // Melissa & Jason Thompson (Rotten Apple 907 & Co-Owners The Haunt Store)... and MORE!
Since forming in 2008, www.TheBrainFactory.com has been involved in a variety of 3D projects.  
HAUNTERS is a passion project, for everyone involved!

campaign.story:
If you've never heard of a boiled peanut before, you're probably feeling a little more than confused. Aren't peanuts usually roasted? Why would you boil them?Peanuts had been eaten boiled for centuries, and it seems to have been a common way of preparing them in antebellum South Carolina when they were green and fresh out of the ground. W. H. Shelton, a Union soldier who was captured in 1864, escaped from a prison camp in Columbia. As he made his way eastward toward Charleston, he was given food by some of the African-American residents he encountered. In his account of his escape, he noted that he was provided on multiple occasions "boiled peanuts, which was a favorite way of cooking when the bean was too green to bake."
During the second half of the 19th century, peanuts became one of the country's most popular snack foods, but in the roasted, not boiled, form. In Northern cities, roasted peanuts were eaten in theaters, at circuses, on trains, and at baseball games. By World War I, peanuts had become a popular ingredient, too, being incorporated into salads, baked into cakes, and folded into an array of candies. But eating them boiled seems to have been confined to just a limited part of the Carolinas.
After enjoying the pleasures of boiled peanuts in the South, for decades, we have moved North and realized they have not ever tried Boiled Peanuts, and never even heard of it!
It will be a unique plan, destined for success as nobody in the North knows, and/or sells Boiled Peanuts, we will be the only source for several hundred miles. We will fine tune our Southern Recipe, and use this recipe to create delicious batches that we distribute through the Farmers Markets of North East Ohio, and we will have successfully introduced our product.

campaign.story:
My project is traditional friendship bread. It is meant to be shared. A person receives a "starter" from a friend. A starter is a yeast fermenting sourdough culture. Person feeds and grows their starter, which is super easy, basically person stirs every day (that's it) and on day 5, feed the yeast. They get flour, milk, and sugar. After 10 days, person divides batter into four. One cup person keeps and bakes with, and the other three person passes along to friends, along with instructions. Super simple. Super delicious. And, there is a huge amount of different food that can be made from a starter. Like waffles, cakes, cookies, pizza dough, pretzels, rolls, biscuits, and cobblers just to name a few. And the starter, so long as fed properly, will stay around indefinitely. Pretty neat stuff. So I have put passion into starter feeding and my bread baking. Made with love. It is all too easy nowadays, to consume food that is "filler". It was convenient, cheap, whatever, but there was no love in it. I just want people to get back to eating at home, and enjoying it, and sharing that enjoyment with others.
So if this project is a success, I will be sending out a lot of starters, just in time for Christmas. What a great gift idea! The starter will be in dehydrated form and have complete instructions for reviving it (super easy), then feeding it, and last baking with it. I also will be making a lot of bread. Most likely I will enlist the help of a friend or two. So please pledge. It is for a great cause- keeping our bellies happy and sharing the love.
