campaign.story:
Like something out of a dream or a fairy tale, the tiny off-grid house I live in evokes a world with cleaner air and water, and a much gentler climate. By sharing my work with you in the form of paper models and other rewards, I hope to build a much improved version of my real house and start a village of them. Together, we can dream a better world into being.
Why Live Tiny and Off-Grid?
People are exploring the tiny life these days because it can drastically cut their clutter and expenses. They end up with more time and money for the people and activities they love. There’s also something wonderful about having everything close at hand. But when people live small, the biggest winner is the web of life that sustains us.
According to National Geographic, human activity is driving species extinct over a thousand times faster than normal. There hasn’t been a mass extinction like this since the one that killed the dinosaurs. Sooner or later, the toll will include species, such as the honeybee, which millions of people depend on for survival. Adjusting a few thermostats won’t help: the extinction rate will continue to increase until we make major cuts in our resource consumption and pollution.
My tiny house uses 30x less materials and energy than the average standalone house. Because it’s so small, it’s easy and relatively inexpensive to take it off-grid. All the electricity and water it uses comes from the sky. The toilet safely converts biohazardous waste into high-quality compost.
I’m developing two sites where clusters of tiny houses would share organic gardens, a diverse fleet of vehicles, and a common house with a commercial kitchen, laundry, lounge and work areas. In such a village, you could enjoy a vibrant community with an amazing standard of living at a tiny fraction of your current monthly expense.
About the Paper Models
The models are approximately 1:60 scale, and exquisitely detailed inside and out. You can build each one in less than an hour without tape or glue.
In the Amaranth model, the exterior forms a ring, and the interior folds up and drops in from above, locking everything into place. Once built, it breaks into four flat pieces small enough to fit in a CD mailer. These can be re-assembled in two minutes.
The backrest for the couch doubles as a second bunk (I sailed 3,400 miles in a boat with flip-up bunks, so I know this works great). It also fits next to the couch to make a queen size bed. Of course this means the front door must open out like a storm door.
The roof locks in place with two tabs that tuck inside the inner walls. If you plan to take it apart much for flat storage and transport, it helps to reinforce the tabs of the exterior with a piece of tape.
In the model, the kitchen counter features drawings of a wood stove, sink, top-loading refrigerator, and a fold-up table.
In the real house, the area under the stove will store 70 gallons of rainwater in self-cleaning tanks with an automatic freeze-proofing system. The battery and inverter under the refrigerator will supply standard house current to the GFCI outlets over the counter and below the vanity mirror. The closed door opposite the wardrobe will open to a composting toilet. It's a 2-way door, creating a private dressing room with a wet bath.
The real Amaranth will measure 7x10 feet plus a 30-inch porch, with an inside area of 59 square feet (Peapod, my current house, is 8’x14’, excluding porch, with 98 square feet inside). Despite its smaller size, Amaranth features better storage than Peapod.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Amaranth models are designed, tested and ready for November delivery. I have limited hard copy production to what I can handle in that time frame. The models are simple, but challenging to put together. Card stock can tear and wrinkle with use; fortunately, you can always print out and build spares as needed.

The Peapod model exterior is ready to go, and I'm working on the interior.

I have limited the number of custom design rewards to a workload that I can handle by the delivery date. The village design reward can start as early as February, weather permitting.

As a second-time builder, there’s still a lot I don’t know, so I am assembling a team of experienced builders who have agreed to consult with me on retainer throughout the project. Among them are Jeff Wilson, author of The Greened House Effect, my neighbor Jeremy Dixon, a builder with off-grid utility experience; Mamerto Tindongan, a renowned wood sculptor and traditional house builder; and Randall Gabriel, a local inventor with mad fabrication skills and a fast-growing solar business.

I am also working to create an owner-builder co-op for tiny houses, so additional labor may be available at critical times during the project. My goal is to develop a local off-grid talent pool versed in a well-defined set of best practices.

I should be able to finish the real Amaranth well before June 1. My current house took 12 weeks to build under the direction of Danny Yahini, another experienced builder. Amaranth uses fewer materials, and this time I know where to get every component, and what the lead times are. I’m creating an indoor space to build all the components in winter, and I’ll order the long lead-time parts as soon the project is funded. This should put me several months ahead of the game.

The QUICK-LOOP is a different kind of mop. It's a simple fabric holder made from oak and steel that can do what other mops can do, and much more. 
            A CLEANER WAY TO DISINFECT
Sponge mops and deck mops trap dirt, bacteria, mold, and odors. QL with a clean cloth on the right.
With the QUICK-LOOP you never have to worry about replacing a soiled sponge, or trying to wring clean a dirty deck mop. It takes one second to replace the fabric with a fresh clean cloth. This is a much more efficient way to disinfect a floor. 
                          READY IN 1 SECOND
Loading the a microfiber cloth into the holder loop
The cloth tucks into the open loop. The loop holds the cloth for dry dusting or wet mopping.
                     DUST FIGHTER
Common flat mop (left) vs. QUICK-LOOP (right) dry dusting
 The QUICK-LOOP with a microfiber cloth is a powerful duster. But not just for floors. The L shape is great for dusting overhead or behind table legs.
                OVERHEAD CLEANING
Dusting an overhead fan (It was pretty gross up there)
                   WET MOPPING 
Protip: Keep the soapy water clean by rinsing a dirty cloth in the sink first.
           YOU CHOOSE THE CLEANER
Use your favorite cleaners!
After wet mopping change to a clean dry cloth and dry the floor quickly. 
The QUICK-LOOP is best thought of as the best kind of combination of a deckmop and a flat mop. Like a deckmop it can focus the power of the scrubbing action into a small area. With the oak dowel I can really scrub hard to clean gunk on the tile, but the spring designed into the steel will keep it from scrubbing too hard and damaging a surface like hardwood. 
       THE GREENEST WAY TO CLEAN
Less disposables saves money and the environment.
                       BUILT FOR LIFE
QUICK-LOOP with a standard U.S. mop handle
Steel and unfinished American oak. No moving parts to wear, no replacement sponges or sheets to buy. The loop traps the cloth and holds it. 
Early adopters will get hand assembled units made by me. 
Hand milled oak
Some background:
The awesome thing about emerging technologies is that sometimes they can be used to make something really simple. QUICK-LOOP is possible due to advances in 3D computer controlled wire forming. Inspired by an old Latin American mop design called the Cuban Mop, the combination of a high tech formed steel spring and the low tech red oak dowel create something totally unique. This cleaner works better, easier, faster, and more economically. It saves money and reduces waste. 
This can work with whatever type of cleaning solution you like. Enough of us are trying to wrap our flat mops in real cloth to save from buying the disposables that companies are making spray or squirt bottles of cleaner. This is a fantastic combination with the QUICK-LOOP. Method, Bona, Murphy's Oil Soap, and many others have spray or squirt wood floor cleaners now.
Next steps:
Please support the project. If you have a sturdy mop handle with a standard American thread (almost all US. mop handles are the same), then choose a Head Only support level. If you'd like us to send you a handle, then choose the full kit level. Both levels are around the price of a couple of disposable refill packs for flat mops. If you know someone that loves cleaning gadgets, please share this project. Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The simplest part of this project is manufacturing the CNC formed wire. The technology for forming wire shapes is amazing, and well established. Springs are easily formed in fantastic shapes with incredible speed. I have contracts with several manufacturers for the spring. 

The tricky part is the low tech oak dowel. Oak is not a uniform material. It does not like to be drilled. The drill bit tends to follow the grain and drift. For mass production this project will require a machine that work with the constraints of the natural material. There are several good machine companies that can tackle the issues. Right now the manual process works fine, but it's slow. Depending on how well this project is supported I'll be able to either greatly improve the manual process or fully automate the drilling and slotting of the red oak. I'm confident that I can support any level of demand.

campaign.story:
I’m not going to pretend that 3D printing doesn’t grow in popularity every day, and that the demand for it doesn’t follow suit, so let’s not kid ourselves. Not only is it a thing of the future, that future is here today! Unfortunately it did kind of sneak up on us, so we at Heroes and Games are going to make sure that you have access to it whenever you need it, and we’ll make sure that it’s affordable for our customers in this weakened economy.
What we want to do here is cater to as many customers as possible. And the best way to possibly do that, is to have two printers. That’s right, two!!! One ceramic and one plastic. That’s why we’ve come up with a list of everyone that would benefit from our store being their one-stop-shop for all things related to their needs in the 3D printing realm. Just imagine how many different types of interests and needs we can cater to with this technology!
One type of customer is the cosplayer. With your help we’ll be able to offer affordable 3D printing for cosplayer’s who want 3D renderings of themselves in costume. They work extremely hard getting those costumes together for every show, and we’ve decided to make it our responsibility to give them the means to solidify (literally) that experience and take it home with them. If you take a look at how detailed these printouts would be, they’ll be a must have for anyone looking for a keepsake from every con. Another type of customer is the table-top gamer. D&D and Warhammer players for example, would be able to create their own terrain or game pieces. How cool would it be to give your characters or avatars a detailed and realistic world to embark on in their adventures?
But those aren’t the only types of customers that we want to help, I’m sure that everyone can think of at least one use for a 3D printer that would apply to them! How about cheerleaders? Athletes? Military Service members? Statues and keepsakes are sought after by a huge portion of collectors, they don’t just have to be related to pop culture.
But let me turn this over to the guys who’ll be making all of your dreams come true! 
Now don’t let me limit your imagination when it comes to what you can create. By having these printers in our store, you’ll be able to create to your imagination’s extent. If there is such a thing. Here’s the catch though, we’re going to need your help to get these things in here. And once they’re in our store, it’ll be for good. And we’ll only have you to thank for it. The best part of getting all of your help, is that the more money we receive, the bigger the ceramic printer we’ll be able to get! And doesn’t bigger always mean better? Of course it does! So any donation that you’ll be able to give will be greatly appreciated.
The staff and patrons of Heroes and Games thank you for your consideration. And we hope that we’ll see you at a convention in our area soon, or while you’re browsing our stock to fill holes in your collection.

I am raising funds for publishing. My goal is to self publish many children's books. My passion is writing and for a long time I didn't have the motivation to write a book, even though I knew that's what I was called to do, until I met my husband. 
I didn't understand our hardships at first, we had a blended family and the outside parents were making our life difficult, as I sat back and watched the relationship of my husband and his daughter demise I felt such a helplessness for him that I could bear no more - he had become a victim of parent bashing and because he was the dad he was not considered a primary parent, I watched him struggle with the courts and the schools, meanwhile the mother has full rights. We are talking about a gentleman who has no criminal record, full time worker and student, but still the odds are against him.  Society does not acknowledge men as Parents as well as they welcome women into parenthood. Dedicating and publishing books just for fathers is just my way of telling society that I believe in fatherhood.

campaign.story:
Why do we all hate kobolds so much? It’s just a matter of course that in every fantasy rpg you play your first level adventurers will go out and murder a couple dozen kobolds, collect their loot, a bit of experience and move on to bigger badder things. Ever wonder what the kobolds thought about all this? Ever think maybe all those kobolds aren’t the bad guys we make them out to be? Well No Country For Old Kobolds is built to explore the world through their eyes!
Sometimes this view of the world can be comedic, sometimes heartbreaking, sometimes heroic.
No Country For Old Kobolds is a tabletop pen and paper rpg based on Dungeon World by Sage LaTorra and Adam Koebel and World of Dungeons by John Harper. While it maintains some of the core mechanics of these two games it has been heavily modified to better model the world of kobolds. 
You'll play champion kobolds - the best of the best - protecting your village from the kingdoms that you created during game setup. As your kobolds die they pass traits down to their children, each generation getting stronger and more capable! You'll fight for your village in a game of survival, heroism and black comedy.
No Country For Old Kobolds is built for up to 6 players including the game master (the storyteller and referee). By funding this game you'll get the full color core rulebook, all digital stretch goals, and access to all beta documentation so you can start playing today! What are you waiting for? Go pledge!
By Jorge F. Muñoz
Shared Characters - All players share the village character. It’s the central character and the only one to advance via XP! 
Generational Play - You'll play multiple generations of kobolds, in No Country For Old Kobolds your player characters actually advance by dying and passing on traits to their young! 
Player Created Worlds - Each player will create the kingdoms that surround the village, they'll also come up with the reasons why those kingdoms hate your village! 
Mission & Story Driven Play - Gameplay is both mission - fulfilling village needs, and story - working to undermine the surrounding kingdoms and create better positioning for your village! 
Death Mechanics - Even after death you'll be able to contribute to combat and help your fellow Kobolds complete their missions! 
Multi-Level Play - No Country For Old Kobolds features multiple levels of play to model just how small and weak kobolds actually are. The three levels of play are kobold, unit and village. Each of these have slightly different rules, moves and mechanics! 
by Jorge F. Muñoz
Whether you’re familiar with Dungeon World or not you shouldn't have any issue grasping the rules for No Country For Old Kobolds. I've specifically designed it to be new player friendly while still providing enough meat for experienced players.
As you create new kobold generations you’ll get to tinker with what abilities and skills to take as well as create new strategies and combinations for their use. As your village grows in numbers and experience you’ll get to choose new moves that will affect all player kobolds, add new recruitable units and generally grow as a group. 
As a GM you’ll find the mission driven gameplay, unit level combat and player generated world do a lot of the heavy lifting for you. These features allow you to focus on creating a rich fiction for the players to delve into and live the lives of kobolds constantly harried by the surrounding kingdoms and all their first level adventurers! 
Here's an play through with the Indie+ folks!
by Jorge F. Muñoz
If you want any of the add-ons simply increase your pledge by the listed amount and I will collect specifics in the surveys at the end of the campaign.

"Chock full of compelling reasons to die and bequeath your essence to your kin." - Aaron Sturghill, playtester 
"The writing is as witty as these slithery creatures are droll." - Kylie Michelle Sturghill, playtester
"No Country For Old Kobolds is the best thing ever to happen to Dungeon World. Throw your money at Steve Wallace now!" - Travis Scott, playtester and creator of DragonKnights!
"No Country for Old Kobolds flips the table on the players. Instead of playing hyper competent adventurers tasked with cleansing the world of evil, the players are handed the weak and misunderstood kobold. Through wits and ingenuity – though some may say cowardice – the characters must survive a world bent on their destruction, or at least better prepare their village and progeny for what lies ahead." - Jeremey Friesen, Origins playtester
"In No Country For Old Kobolds, the sad short life of a kobold is brought into focus with joyful black humor as their everyday problems incite an epic struggle that the players themselves helped to design. While at first you are left thinking the goal might be to achieve the most glorious death possible, for me it really is more about personal sacrifice so that your community, your family, can continue to exist. In this game, Kobolds are equal parts Jan Valjean, Pagliacci, and the Three Stooges." - Jason Cox, playtester

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk with most rpg kickstarters is that the rules won’t be finished and polished on time. To avoid that I've completed multiple drafts of the core rules already and have heavily play tested them.

Being an artist myself I know that delays with art can seriously hinder deadlines. To mitigate issues with such delays I'm working with artists who I know personally and have proven to me they can be trusted to deliver on time. On top of that I have other artists who can pick up the slack if something dire happens.

 
Because printing delays and quality can often be an issue with books I've decided to work with a printer whose product I already own and who comes highly recommended by others in the industry. On top of that they're within driving distance of me so that I can not only provide on site feedback for quality control but I can also pick up the books instead of having them shipped which should alleviate the chance of damage in bulk processing. 

Shipping this quantity of materials can always be a challenge, having been in the self publishing industry for 15 years I've had to deal with shipping all kinds of art, books and comics and know the time and commitment I'm making here. I'll endeavor to spend ship quickly and keep everyone informed during the fulfillment process.

campaign.story:
Blackspoon Press, in association with Silence in the Library Publishing, is excited to bring you The Bard's Tale - an anthology of short fantasy stories told by or about bards.
The Stories
The authors in this collection of 15 short stories each give their own spin to the concept of the bard, with tales running the gamut from traditional high fantasy to urban and post-apocalyptic fantasy.
The authors of The Bard's Tale are:  Donald J. Bingle, Dylan Birtolo, Tracy Chowdhury, Maxwell Alexander Drake, Stephanie Drummonds, Ed Greenwood, Sarah Hans, Gabrielle Harbowy, Rosemary Jones, C.S. Marks, Muffy Morrigan, Daniel Myers, Brian Pettera, Aaron Rosenberg, and Kelly Swails.
For this anthology we have chosen to follow the model pioneered by Silence in the Library Publishing.  The funding goal for this project was set at a level necessary to produce the anthology and pay the authors a competitive rate for their work, Should the project go above and beyond, the authors will share equally with the publisher in any profit from the sale of books.
The Recipes
Ever wonder what a real bard would eat?  Each of the stories in the anthology will be accompanied by a real recipe from a fictional tavern, The Black Dragon Inn.  The recipes have been carefully adapted from a variety of sources, including medieval European cooking manuscripts, to reflect the unique cuisine of a fantasy world while still appealing to the modern palate.
The Black Dragon Inn is one of those strange little places that exists on the edge of town that somehow seems to be the center of action while still being a quiet refuge. There is a fire in the open hearth that lights the wood of the tables and bar with its warm, flickering glow. The air is filled with smells of wood smoke, and ale, and roasting meat. The barkeep looks up from filling pints for other patrons and nods to you. "Take a seat," she says, "and I'll get you something to eat."
Illustrations
Each of the stories in this anthology will be illustrated by David Szilagyi. Here is David's illustration for "The Haunting of the Lordly Lion" by Ed Greenwood.
Add-ons
$15 - A signed 8x10 print of an illustration of your choice from the anthology (if you're an international backer, please add $3 for shipping)  
$20 - A signed 11x14 print of an illustration of your choice from the anthology. (if you're an international backer, please add $3 for shipping) 
$15 - An extra trade paperback copy of The Bard's Tale (If you've backed at an electronic reward-only level, please add $5 for shipping. If you're an international backer and have backed at a print reward level, please add $5 for shipping. If you're an international backer and have backed at an electronic reward only level, please add $20 for shipping)
Stretch Goals
The Bard's Tale is all about telling stories, so the stretch goals are centered around getting more stories into the hands of the readers.

campaign.story:
Since opening last April, Hot Chicken Takeover (HCT) has grown faster than we ever anticipated. We've met and served over 8,000 people so far and are excited to grow HCT into additional neighborhoods, businesses, AND days of the week. We believe the most efficient way to do this is with a mobile kitchen – allowing us to take the HCT experience anywhere our customers lead us.

Back Story.
In November last year, my wife and I took an adventure to Nashville, Tennessee. Among many things in that town, we instantly fell in love with the tradition and community around hot chicken. The wheels started spinning immediately.
When we returned, we started testing recipes and hosting hot chicken parties at our house. The chicken kept getting better and the group kept getting larger. And somehow – alongside having a new baby – we went from parties to concept dinners to pre-sale events at the Columbus Food Hub in April.

Mission.
Beyond great food, we're passionate about bringing together an eclectic and diverse community of customers. Our guests have come from every pocket of Central Ohio (and beyond) and are met with hospitality, not just from our team, but from one another. We're very excited to extend this HCT community even further. A mobile kitchen will make this happen.
Additionally, our business exists to support a unique employment mission. We rely on strong partners like Community Properties of Ohio and The Columbus Urban League to refer job candidates who are highly motivated to work but have barriers to successful employment - often ranging from less-than-marketable work histories to run-ins with the criminal justice system. Once hired, employees receive significant support, coaching, and investment to support them as they move forward. 
The addition of mobile selling should over double our current volume. This means up to a dozen new job opportunities at HCT - a big increase in sustainable impact through employment. These jobs would be in addition to the jobs already provided in our Olde Towne East location.
And lastly, we make sure no food goes to waste. All inventory that remains at the end of our day heads to Faith Mission shelters.
Half of the team!

Trailer Design.
After many, many conversations with industry leaders and mentors, we've opted for a trailer versus a food truck for our mobile kitchen. A trailer provides more versatility in design but also eliminates the risk of a failed engine or vehicle mechanicals (i.e. if our truck breaks down, we can always borrow or rent another tow vehicle). We're currently finalizing plans for construction and anticipate a 10-12 week period for completion.

The trailer has been designed to accommodate 4-6 kitchen staff stations and has sufficient capacity to serve 600 people in a 4hr time frame. The estimated budget, with equipment, is 50-70k.
The first draft - drawn two months ago!

Have Trailer. Will Travel.
Once complete, we'll immediately use the trailer for unique selling opportunities this winter (we're very close to talking publicly about these!). Beyond that point, we intend on taking our restaurant on the road throughout both Franklin and Delaware counties. HCT will seek opportunities to serve new neighborhoods by setting up shop for 2-4 weeks, expanding the same set-up and dining experience customers have had in Olde Towne East.
The trailer also provides the opportunity to serve special events and businesses. We've dabbled in this space on several occasions but have an inadequate set-up to do it profitably and reliably. We've begun discussions with several large corporate campuses - though they may change their minds when they learn about #HotChickenNaps (we'll file that under 'Risks and Challenges').

Funding Goals.
This Kickstarter is our first push for the big investment anticipated going forward. On top of the trailer, we hope to invest in an additional restaurant set-up (tables, benches, tents, etc), reliable tow vehicle, and upgraded kitchen equipment. The funding goal of 40k is the minimum goal needed for us to move forward but the additional goals bring our anticipated investment closer to 80k.

Gold-on-Black.
We worked hard to imagine worthy rewards for your contributions. One of the coolest is this limited edition HOMAGE t-shirt. 
Limited Edition HOMAGE for HCT: Gold on Black!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We believe in this plan. But we also have enough experience to know that even the best of plans can change. 

During this process of going mobile, we'll be managing a whole new slew of variables and challenges - everything from permits to managing our trailer builder to new equipment maintenance and more. These will definitely be growth opportunities for our leadership team and staff. And if our assumptions and plans have gaps, we could definitely incur delays in execution.

An additional risk is that we've underestimated the costs of this plan. We'll continue to rely on great mentors in the industry to check our assumptions and plans moving forward.

updates.update_content:
But thank you. A million times over.
From the beginning of this adventure, we knew HCT was special. And now, more than ever, we understand why. We've got the most generous, gracious customers a business could imagine. 
We often tell our employees that 'we invest in you, because you've invested in us.' It seems the only appropriate thing to share the same with you. You've made a tremendous investment in us - we promise to do the same for you.

This wild ride is coming to an end. 
We've made tremendous progress on our stretch goals and are more excited than ever to begin fulfilling these rewards. Thank you for all your contributions, best wishes, and commentary to date. The HCT community never ceases to amaze us!
Please consider sharing the campaign once more within your network - we'd welcome any of those last minute contributions.

We're excited to announce the Hot Chicken & Waffle party has a date! 
We'll be unveiling our waffles and house syrup on Sunday, December 7th from noon to 4 - brunch style. It's going down at The Kitchen in historic German Village. The venue (also funded with a Kickstarter) is as well-crafted as Miss B's Banana Pudding. It's got space for music, space for drinks (the adult kind), AND most importantly, space for you to live it up.
We've got a slew of tricks up our sleeve to make this party even cooler. That said, we're quickly approaching capacity for The Kitchen and have had to limit the remaining tickets. If you're feeling ready to party, don't hesitate to your pledge in time.

THANK YOU for all your support to date.

We're still catching our breath from last week! In the last 5 days we were on Good Day Columbus, served two mayors, then another 1200 guests, AND hit our first goal on Kickstarter!
Simultaneous to all these events, we've been working hard to lock down our trailer fabricator while learning as much as we can from others in the mobile food industry. One thing we definitely learned, we underestimated several costs! So we're very grateful for the continued momentum on our campaign.

Today marks the end of day 7 for HCT's Kickstarter - we're approaching 70% of our goal! THANK YOU for so much support and sharing. 
This past week has been a whirlwind - we're grateful to have spoken to so many of you about our campaign and next steps. We've also been working hard to complete the technical specs of our trailer. Though this has taken longer than anticipated, we feel confident that it'll be done right.

Holy moley. We just wrapped up our first 24 hours on Kickstarter and we couldn't be more grateful for all your generosity. As of a few minutes ago, we had accomplished over 40% of the minimum goal we laid out - this is just shy of the down payment we anticipate on the mobile kitchen. We even learned that some of our most prolific customers are crowdfunding for an HCT party for 100 fans (the $1,600 reward tier). We'll gladly accept that invite.
THANK YOU for all your support. Please keep spreading the word, we're excited to keep our momentum going!

Alice in Wonderland - Chicago/Cleveland. Scena Polonia's first ever production of Alice In Wonderland in Chicago's Copernicus Center last June was quite a success. As a matter of fact, news about the show apparently spread to Cleveland where the Shrine Church of St.Stanislaus has asked our company to play the performance for hundreds of Polish school children. We will also be playing a few more shows right here in Chicago.
As we mentioned in our last attempt at raising funds, the costs for us are high in creating the show. Now we have to add transportation, facility and extra equipment costs. Unfortunately, the school is unable to assist with much of the cost of our production but that shouldn't prevent them from being able to see this wonderful performance as it was played in Chicago. This is where you, the Kickstarter community comes in. Our overhead costs include truck rental to bring our equipment and set to their stage, extra equipment that is needed for audio and visual effects that their stage does not have. and salaries as our actors and crew are paid semi-professionals. Our Chicago show will be in the next few months and also needs this funding to secure our theater date. Your dollars will go to both Chicago and Cleveland shows.

Risks and challenges
Producing a theater performance in a traveling setting with paid cast and crew is a costly venture. Vehicle rental costs for equipment, cast and crew, fuel, insurance, salaries, etc. In our short two year existence, we have raised the bar for theater excellence in the Polish community. We make no apologies for our passion in the theatrical arts and the interest in our company proves that. It takes a lot of hard work otherwise known as blood, sweat, tears and finances to invest in your passion. Sometimes though, a little assistance from like minded venturers goes a long way. Together, we can face this challenge head on and bring our show to Cleveland for these little wonders to see. There is no greater joy than to perform for all the smiling faces. Afterall, they are much of the reason for our existence!

And yes baked good should be indulgent, decadent and know one really counts their calories when they want a hunk of chocolate cake.  But why can't they be decadent and made with whole ingredients?  
Today I am reworking my campaign. I can't change the ask, but I can add the rewards and show you behind the scenes of what may come.  Stay tuned.

11 days in and I seem to have hit a plateau.  Working a fundraising campaign is a daily grind. Behind the scenes I have been working diligently on recipes for our menu, which is finally complete for the Fall of 2014.
The ultimate goal of course is to open our shop in Cleveland.  Cupcakes will be part of the menu, yet I am expanding into macarons, pastries, and homemade marshmallows.
Stay tuned I will post our new menu soon.

4 Days in and we are 26% funded.  Thank you to my 6 backers.  I can't see your names until I hit 10 to thank you personally.  Although based on a recent tweet I at least know one of you.  I had an earlier crowd funding loan campaign earlier this year that I hit up my family for.  So this time around I am looking for kind citizens to fund my cupcake venture.
My Fairy Cupcake is part of the whole dream.  A product line of Olivia Rose Confections, LLC and will be included in my shop The Sugar Peddler.  Why so many names? I realize I should settle on 1 but they all seem to have a life of their own.  My marshmallows, cupcakes, eclairs, and now macarons come together collectively to make up my culinary repertoire.

"Visions of Light: A Christmas Story" 
Author: Piper C. Hawkins
Illustrator:  Kathleen "Fred" Streitenberger
Publisher: For Good Media
Piper's Story and the Book
9-year-old Piper has always loved making homemade books! Several years ago, she and her mom Kristen went to a local book festival called Books by the Banks in Cincinnati, OH.  Piper was so inspired!  She decided right then and there to publish one of her many stories by the time she was 10-years-old and apply for a booth at Books by the Banks in 2015!
Piper's mom, Kristen, encouraged her to create a story about goodness in the world.  With a lot of imagination and hard work, Piper wrote an uplifting and inspirational tale:
"When young Alice and her kindly old neighbor, Mr. Fredricks (who always reminds Alice of Santa Claus), accidentally collide in the hall of their apartment building, his glasses fall off — and that’s when the magic begins! Alice puts on the glasses out of curiosity and is enchanted to see what Mr. Fredricks sees: the love and light in others.
Join Alice and Mr. Fredricks on a magical journey down Main Street, and let Mr. Fredricks show how kindness towards others makes a difference in us all. You won’t want to miss what Alice adds to her Christmas wish list after this special day!"    
Beautifully illustrated, professionally edited and printed in high quality paper with a laminated cover, this book will bring Christmas magic to every day as a reminder to treat others well.
Excerpt from "Visions of Light: A Christmas Story"
 “My spectacles show the love that is inside of everyone. The people with a lot of love and wonder — those who believe in kindness and joy, including the Christmas spirit — shine brightly.” said Mr. Fredricks.
Alice asked, “Do you mean people on the Nice List?”  Mr. Fredricks just gave her a knowing smile.   He put the glasses back on Alice’s nose and told her to look around the lobby of their building — what did she see?
There was a baby in a stroller who shone as bright as the sun!
“So what do people on the Naughty List look like?” Alice asked. 
What's Next?
All of the artwork is at Kahny Printing for layout/production and the final printed book will be ready by the first week of October 2014!

Funds raised will pay for the expense of printing 500 books.
Cover Art Prep
Credit for Music in the video to Derek Clegg, "Flat"

campaign.story:
Constantly finding yourself in inopportune never-ending conversations?  
MiracleFone is a device created to offer you relief from the frustrations surrounding undesired interactions by giving you an opportunity to politely excuse yourself from inopportune conversations in real-time.
MiracleFone vs Smartphone Fake Call Apps
The Device
 How It Works
MiracleFone.com
The website is developed and is fully functional. It may need some graphic design work, but the functionality has been successfully tried and tested. If one wanted to visit miraclefone.com today, they could purchase a fob that would work just fine with an iPhone (see a little further down about other types of cell phones). 
Website's Functionalities: 
Purchasing and registering fobs 
Pairing the fobs with Bluetooth enabled phones 
Programing numbers for all 3 available fob buttons (could all be the same number) 
Assigning callback messages to each programmed number 
Monitoring fob usage 
Purchasing additional callbacks 
Supporting customer inquires through backend customer service representative functionalities
 A Video Demonstration of the Device & Website Interface
PLAY

Where We Stand Today
Secret under the desk button or inconspicuously on a key chain.
Years of considerable time, money, and effort have already been dedicated to designing and manufacturing the fobs, website, and the callback system. As one can see from the picture above, we've already gone ahead and produced the first batch of fobs. Also, as already highlighted, we've already successfully developed the functionality of the website and the overall callback system.
MiracleFone: A Brief Historical Recap
By the end of 2012 we were ready to start selling our first batch of fully functional fobs. While we were beta testing our first batch and preparing an updated marketing strategy, we discovered that certain cell phone manufacturers had recently tweaked their products' Bluetooth functionalities often resulting in their brand's Bluetooth accessories (e.g. headsets) becoming the only compatible options. Unfortunately, the MiracleFone team didn't plan on this change and it resulted in our fobs becoming incompatible with many major cell phones (not including the Apple iPhone which still currently works just fine with the fobs).
MiracleFone: Onward!
Your Kickstarter funds will go directly to retooling the mechanisms found inside the fobs and the overall call back processes. These updates will further ensure that if future Bluetooth changes are implemented by cell phone manufacturers, the capability of our fobs to successfully generate a callback will not be affected. 
We have the knowledge, experience, motivation, and the contacts needed to retool and get a finished product out to the market, but the entire process will require additional funding. We are seeking your Kickstarter contributions to help fund the next steps.
Rewards
**Please note that we have hundreds of finished fobs ready for use for iPhone users. Due to Bluetooth changes certain cell phone manufacturers made to their products, non-iPhone users will have to wait for the second generation of fobs to be manufactured (with help from the Kickstarter funding) before we can mail their reward fobs highlighted below.**
Team Bio
Hi, my name is Mike Miracle and a few years ago I was confronted with a common problem people have when dealing with other people; it seems that I consider my time more valuable than other people do.  The situation was this; I was in my office, doing my work when a co-worker came in.  He didn’t seem to have anything better to do than to come in and talk to me about local sports.  Normally, I give someone about two minutes of chit-chat kinda back and forth before I move on. Being trapped in my office, I had nowhere to move on to.  So I thought, wouldn't it be great to have a button you could press that would make your phone ring?  Something small, simple and easily hidden so no one would see you use it.  I could press the button, my phone would ring a few seconds later, I would answer, respond to the voice at the other end by saying, “Can you hold on a second, I have someone in my office” and tell the intruder to “Please excuse me, I have to take this call”.  How awesome would that be?

Soon after, I got a couple of my friends behind the project and we got rolling with designing, prototyping, and testing the fob and the website. Below is one of our original sketches. 
Team Skill Background

Mike Miracle (me) -I have been a business application software developer for nearly 40 years, including insurance, mining and educational software application domains.  For about 20 years I have been a software consultant and my wife and I have owned and operated another local business for the past 20 years.  I have always enjoyed the challenges associated with solving difficult technical problems, which is why this project appealed so much to me.  Although it might seem that giving the product my family name is an act of vanity, the truth is, it just sounded catchy.  Hope you don’t mind.

I have trusted contacts in the manufacturing, legal, financial, and web/smartphone app development industries within my network that I have already utilized or plan on tapping into to contribute to the success of MiracleFone.
Seth Stern- Seth is truly the technical wizard behind the scenes of MiracleFone.  His areas of expertise are vast and deep, also spanning the decades elapsed since punched cards.

campaign.story:
Oddmall: Emporium of the Weird is SUPER FUN! It's an enormous Art Fair and Craft Show, featuring the works of dozens of local, national, and international artists. It's also a really happenin' COMIC, GEEK, MUSIC, GAME, and ENTERTAINMENT CONVENTION, with all the awesome stuff such a thing entails. And the best part... ADMISSION IS ABSOLUTELY FREE!!!
We've done eleven Oddmall events in Ohio so far (and two in Seattle) and the show keeps getting bigger and better every time, attracting vendors and visitors from all over the country. Last May we moved from the comparably small Clarion hotel to the immense and wonderful John S. Knight Center in downtown Akron. The move allowed us to expand the Emporium of the Weird to epic proportions, attracting over 7000 attendees and more than 220 vendors. This time around we're hoping to expand yet again. It's our first TWO DAY SHOW in Ohio and we have 275 booths currently on the map and space for more.
The next show is November 1-2, 2014 in Akron, Ohio. Oddmall is the winner of the Akron / Canton Hotlist Award for Best Arts & Crafts, in case that sort of knowledge is of interest.
Well, see, that's the thing. We moved from a relatively small and inexpensive venue to a very large and extremely pricey location. This has allowed us to make Oddmall the show we always wanted it be, with all the incredible crafts, art, games, cosplay, tattoos, live entertainment, and assorted awesomeness we can imagine. It was a BIG move and vital to the continuance of Oddmall.
We are absolutely committed to keeping Oddmall FREE. We will NEVER charge admission for Oddmall. We set out to make Oddmall the sort of show we would want to attend, and we don't want to pay to attend it, so you don't have to either. Comparable events charge upwards of $50-80 a day, but that's just not how Oddmall rolls.
Obviously, there are significant costs involved in running a show like Oddmall. Without disclosing the actual amounts, believe me when I tell you the venue costs, labor charges, advertising fees, and supply expenditures add up to A LOT. Of course, the vendors do pay for their spaces, but I'm not comfortable increasing their fees any higher than they are now, which are as low as I can make them and still make it worth our time to host the show. So, we won't charge admission and we won't pass the costs on to the vendors. What are we to do? What indeed...
Oh, I know! We could hold a Kickstarter campaign and offer people a bunch of great rewards and sponsorship opportunities to help defray some of the expense. Yeah, that's what we'll do. In fact, it's what we're doing right now.
First off, the funds raised through this Kickstarter will help us pay the monumental costs associated with holding an event of this size and offering free admission. Once the venue is paid off, a substantial amount will be spent on advertising, increasing public awareness and bringing more people to the show. We'll also use a chunk of the proceeds to stock the Oddmall gift shop with T-shirts, stickers, stuffed monsters, and all those other things in the Rewards section, as well as producing those things and shipping them to the Kickstarter backers.
Additionally, we have set a few Stretch Goals that might be of interest:
Stretch Goal #1 ($500): Expanded Trick or Treating
Trick or treating will be happening all day Saturday at Oddmall. If we reach this first modest stretch goal trick or treaters who visit the Oddmall Gift Shop will receive an Oddmall button or sticker along with their sweet, sweet candy or lame box of raisins (while supplies last). ATTAINED!
Stretch Goal #2 ($1000): Super Awesome Oddmall Halloween Party  
This will be an Oddmall Halloween costume party on Friday night (October 31) at The Empire (a brand new club in Akron). All Oddmall vendors and their guests will be receive a free invitation! There will be live music, a costume contest, and all sorts of other super nifty jazz.
Stretch Goal #3 ($2000): Expanded Kid Cave
The Oddmall Kid Cave (sponsored by The Goddard School) is a great place for kids to hang out while their parents take time to shop and enjoy the various whatnots of Oddmall. Certified preschool teachers are on hand to entertain the kids with crafts, games, and other exciting jazz. If we raise $2000 or more, we'll expand the Kid Cave into a larger room (rather than the landing it currently occupies), which will allow the kids more space for their activities and assorted rambunciousnesses.
Stretch Goal #4 ($4000): Anime Theater
If we reach $4000 we'll set up a movie theater room showing anime and cult films during show hours. It'll be super fun and, as always, admission will be totally free.
Stretch Goal #5 ($6000): Oddmall Coloring Book
We'll make a sweet Oddmall coloring book, featuring art by world famous international superstar illustrator / super model Andy Hopp (that's me, hi). It will be given FOR FREE to the all the kids who come to Oddmall (while supplies last).
Stretch Goal #6 ($6,034): Potato Salad
Apparently potato salad is a thing people on the internet are into nowadays. Who knew... If we reach this goal there will be some Official Homemade Oddmall Potato Salad at the Saturday night party.
Stretch Goal #7 ($7,000): It's a secret...
I'll reveal this stretch goal and others as they approach.
Of course, we aren't just looking for free handouts. In addition to the whole FREE art fair, craft show, live entertainment, and pop culture con thing we have plenty of sweet rewards for our backers (including a chance to be a permanent part of the brand new Oddmall Trailer!). 
Backers may either pick up their rewards at Oddmall (in the Oddmall Gift Shop) or have them mailed directly (domestic shipping is included at no extra charge).
You can nab any of these by selecting the appropriate reward listed on the right hand side of this page, or by adding the listed amount to any other pledge. Here they are:
The Oddwall
This big sign, prominently displayed at Oddmall and on the Oddmall Ohio website lists the name (or business name or web address) of every single person who backs this campaign (as well as all of our vendors and sponsors).
Oddmall Sticker (+$1)
This official Oddmall: Emporium of the Weird Sticker features a big blue eyeball. There's also one with an Oddball on it. You can get extra stickers by adding $1 for each sticker to any other pledge.
Oddmall Balloon (+$1)
This balloon, decked out with a snazzy Oddmall logo and available in four colors (pink, orange, brown, purple), is only a buck. Add $1 to any pledge for each extra balloon.
Oddmall Postcard (+$2)
Here's a postcard featuring everybody's favorite character Boss Rob, showing off his giant paintbrush and bucket of Happy Tree paint. Add $2 to any pledge for each additional postcard if you are thusly inclined.
Oddmall Button (+$3)
These nifty 2" pinback buttons are decorated with the Oddmall eyeball. All the cool kids are wearing them. Add one to any pledge for just $3.
Oddmall Embroidered Patch (+$15)
A delightful 2" circular Oddmall embroidered patch can be yours by adding a mere $15 to any pledge.
Oddmall Mouse Pad (+$15)
It's an 8" circular mousepad featuring the Oddmall eyeball. It can be yours by adding $15 to any pledge. 
Oddmall T-Shirt (+$20)
We'll feature at least two Oddmall T-shirt designs this year. For the low, low sum of just twenty clams added to any pledge you can nab one for yourself!
Oddmall Tote Bag (+20)
By popular demand, we've added a snazzy new Oddmall tote bag to the lineup. This has been just about the most requested item in Oddmall history and it can be yours for only $20!
Oddmall Knit Cap (+$25)
Is your head cold. Do you have an unsightly bald spot you want to cover (I do). Boy golly, do we have just the thing for you. It's a swell knit cap with the Oddmall logo on it. Not only will people find you sexier (and warmer), it will also look like you're sporting a third eye (because the Oddmall logo is an eyeball). How cool is that?
Super Cool Oddmall Cape (+$35)
Not only can you nab yourself a sweet handmade Oddmall cape, but you'll also be invited to participate in the official Heroes of Oddmall photo shoot! (picture coming soon).
Handmade Oddmall Oddball Plush Monster (+$45)
Krystal handmakes each one with love. They are large and snugglable and one-of-a-kind!
Oddmall Oddball Plushy
Trailer Logo (+20 and up)
We have this awesome new trailer that we'll use to haul all of our official jazz back and forth to Oddmall, Con on the Cob, and various art fairs, craft shows, and cons throughout the year. It's going to be covered in sweet, colorful graphics espousing our various endeavors. Certain portions of the trailer will be reserved for graphics showing off our amazing friends and sponsors (that's you). Starting at only $20 you can have your name, logo, or image affixed, in full color, as a permanent part of the trailer for all to see. The amount of space you get to cover is based on how much you pledge, as follows:
$20: 4"x4"

$100: 12"x12"$150: 8"x24"

You provide the artwork and we'll make the decals. If you'd rather have us do the art we can work that out too.
Program Book Ads
Oddmall's full color program book is handed out free to all guests (while supplies last). It includes maps, entertainment schedules, vendor lists, artwork, and other important information and snazzy jazz. It's also a great place to plop your ads and coupons. Just add the listed amount to any pledge to get yourself the ad or coupon you desire (you supply the art).
$25: Business card sized ad or coupon (2″x3″)

$200: Full page ad or coupon (5.5″x8.5″)
Vendor Booths (+$80 and up)
Oddmall offers three different vendor booth sizes (8'x3', 6'x8', and 10'x10'). You can nab one through this kickstarter, which is what I'd recommend if you also want to get your hands on any of our other rewards, or you can reserve one directly on the Oddmall website. Vendors get to choose their own booth based on the map and list found here. That means the sooner you sign up the more chance you'll have of getting the specific booth you want. If we run out of booths on that map we'll get more rooms from the convention center, so don't worry if it's getting full.
You may bring your own tables or rent one from the convention center by adding $10 to your pledge. If you want electricity please add $60 to your pledge (this charge is from the convention center, not us).
Note: The Oddmall Art Fair is reserved for vendors who are selling handmade items (including original art, art reproductions, jewelry, toys, plushies, costumes, etc...) created by the seller or a representative thereof. The Geek Expo is open to anyone selling anything cool (toys, games, books, costumes, art, just about anything...).
Special Instructions for Kickstarter Backers
If you nab your booth through the kickstarter please fill out the registration form as soon as you make your pledge so we can get you the booth you want. Just put KICKSTARTER BACKER in the section that says "Notes or Special Instructions". Click SUBMIT but then close the window when PayPal opens (please don't cancel your pledge after you reserve your booth, that would really mess us up).

Market Day 2014
What is Akron Honey Company all about and what's the deal with urban honey?
Akron Honey Company is 'Akron's Sweet Spot', and is the first urban beekeeping/ micro batching honey operation to arrive in Urban Akron, Ohio.  Different plants in different parts of our area allow our honeybees to make a very unique and area specific type of honey. In order to capture the different varieties, we are expanding to another location in Akron.  Thus, by harvesting a few times throughout the year, we can showcase the different flavors of the neighborhoods.
Crestland Park Apiary
Where have and will you keep your bees?
Over the last year and a half we bought some vacant land right here in the city, built a fence, and began raising bees. Our bees will be kept on additional vacant land, and hosted by some of Akron's residents and organizations.  Our eyes are on Akron's North Hill area for our second apiary site situated on vacant land.
Variety and Organic
Featured at the Eye Opener
Why Urban Honey over traditional honey?
Although we initially planned on keeping the honey for ourselves, upon our first harvest last year everything changed after tasting the dark, rich, full taste of our fall urban honey. The rest is history and we are doing the same thing again next year. Urban Honey is extremely unique, and since the bees are foraging in Akron's neighborhoods, each batch of honey holds the identity of that neighborhood. Additionally, honeybees do very well in our area because of the variety in their food sources. The flowers they feast on are all over the place, and vary in kind.  And with our Urban Honey, the consumer will know in exactly what area the honey was made, and the exact date the honey was harvested.  We label all of that information.
So how will the funds be used?
Every penny will be used in the most frugal manner. In order to grow from 7 to somewhere around 25 hives, we need boxes for the bees, the bees themselves, the land, honey storage, and bottling supplies. The recipe is simple, yet it takes a lot of work, funding and dedication to see this through. I've done it all by myself once, and I'm ready to light this town up and do it again.
You mentioned needing 10 more hives in the video, but also mention growing to around 25?
Growing responsibly is not something to be taken lightly. This is a sensitive craft, since this is agriculture based. 10 hives is a safe number I'm willing to place at any location to test the waters. Factors that could harm the bees include available food sources, miscellaneous pesticide spraying, and any diseases in the area. After I see it is safe for them, we will increase the size of the colonies on site. If you are going to undertake a duty such as this, you must do it right, not fast.

campaign.story:
Men have beards, and while doing manly activities like wading through swamps, wrestling bears, scaling redwoods, and bare knuckle boxing, those beards can get out of control. Seeing that (real) men don’t carry purses or have fanny-packs, there’s little room to carry an awkward, bulky or long comb. That’s why I created the HandleBeard; a small, rugged, durable device that will clip onto a keychain, belt loop, etc. Don’t go around town known as the dude with the jacked up frizz-face. Get your beard in order, no matter where your next adventure takes you.
The HandleBeard
The MEGA HB
As promised, those with the thickest and longest of beards can opt for the MEGA HB. The teeth are double in length, and the overall width is just under an inch longer. The teeth are also a hair (no pun intended) wider to increase the durability of each tooth. The MEGA HB has the same tooth spacing which will minimizes the hangups in those thick beards. This model is obviously not as portable as the original, but still more portable compared to other options out there! Here is a 3d model of what the MEGA HB will look like.
MEGA HB
Comparison
The Construction
The HandleBeard is CNC machined (water jet cut) from a solid piece of 1/8 inch thick aluminum. It's then sandblasted and anodized in black to make a smooth finish. In order to make it easy to carry (whether on your keys or in your pocket) the total length of the HandleBeard is only 3.5 inches. This gives more than enough room to groom, but allows it to be very portable, light, and strong.
After making numerous prototypes, I made the teeth of the comb spaced out a bit wider than many other beard combs on the market. I found this much more pleasant than the narrow spaced teeth and won't get caught up in thicker beards. The carabiner is solid stainless steel, so there's no way this thing is getting loose and lost.
The Design
My goal was to create something unique and appealing, but that also had the durability and functionality for rougher bearded men, all at an affordable price. This is the reason I decided to make the HandleBeard one solid piece, teeth and all. As a Stretch Goal, I would love to create a premium version in titanium as well as offer multiple colors. I would also like to offer custom engraving down the road to really personalized it.
What Will I Do with the Investment?
Making the HandleBeard in low volumes is simply not an option due to the high machining cost. This round of money will get me enough people so that I am able to fund a first inventory run, which will lower the cost down to an affordable level. To give you an idea, 1 prototype cut and finished was quite costly, but obviously the cost falls substantially when a larger order is made.
I already have a machining company ready and lined up, which has impressed me with both the quality and the cost per unit. Now it's all about seeing if the interest is there to fuel a minimum order quantity as well as expand the material options and colors.
Stretch Goals?
I would love to be able to produce these in multiple colors. As of now they will only be made in black, but if enough people back the project, I may be able to offer a few color options. After a social media polling, green, gold, and metallic or gun metal may be the next options.
My second stretch goal would be to get a premium model made out of titanium. This metal is obviously much more expensive, but very light and strong.
Last stretch goal would be to offer custom engraving on the front. Examples would be initials, company logos, charities, etc. This would really personalize each HandleBeard and be great options for gifts, groomsmen gifts, company swag, etc.

The only issue I have had with the final prototype was that the carabiner was not springing back into place as well as I would have liked, but I have already talked with the engineer and a simple adjustment was made to the spacing of the holes that holds the carabiner in place, so this has been taken care of! If funded, the facility is ready to produce the first round asap!

campaign.story:
What is Programming the Future?
Simply put, Programming the Future (PtF) aims to make learning Computer Science fun for everyone. Our goal is to make lessons simple enough that even children (and interested adults) can keep up with the ideas and get excited about Computer Science! PtF will be constructed as an online, interactive textbook that uses mini-games to teach important coding concepts. We want to approach programming more as a foreign language rather than an abstract math problem. While learning a language, one learns not only vocabulary and grammar but also cultural stories, relational values and ways of thinking. Every language opens a new and exciting cultural door; programming needs to be perceived the same way. Instead of painting a monotonous picture of hunting down a missing semi-colon for three hours, we will show what programming really is: it is fluid problem solving; it is research; it is trial and error. It is a giant puzzle that requires persistence and creativity--skills valuable to people who will never even touch a programming interface.
Why is this important?
As science and technology grow, there is an increasing demand for computer scientists, but  there is also a decreasing interest amongst students in the STEM fields. Although this is the first generation of children to have had easy access to technology for their entire lives, enrollment rates in STEM fields are still dropping. By the time these students reach college many of them have typically already formed their opinion of STEM fields--with most deciding it isn't for them. To make matters worse, as many as 40% of science majors change their mind while in college because they were underprepared for their classes, with as many as 30-60% of college freshman failing their first programming course. This is because Computer Science is often taught as a highly technical, confusing subject and the "you're either a programmer or you're not" mentality runs rampant. Instead, with a little ingenuity and creativity, Computer Science can be taught so that it reaches people of all different thinking styles.
How will it work?
Programming the Future is different because we are aiming to teach programming--without any mandatory programming. This is an approach called 'visual coding' in which Computer Science fundamentals are taught in theory, separate from a programming language. It works on the premise of being able to quickly pick up any language once you understand the core principles involved. This is great for business professionals who may never do any coding but need to understand database schemas or for children trying to develop analytical thinking skills. This concept is currently being investigated with children in math, presenting math as being about patterns and structures rather than tiny numbers to manipulate. Dr. Droujkova started teaching small children algebra and calculus, having children do things like create fractals, which allows children to explore recursion and infinitesimals. In keeping with her ideas, Programming the Future will use a series of mini-games and videos to convey important coding concepts. If learning is to be as efficient as possible, it's essential that children want to learn. Teaching through games opens up the concept of 'free play;' students can control how long they play and what they learn, preserving the excitement of learning.

campaign.story:
Our campaign was supported by LaunchPack. Learn more at launchpack.co
THE BIG PICTURE
We’re really excited to be back with Fire & Bone II, a brand-new collection of amazing, true-to-life jewelry and collectibles derived from real animal skulls.
Why are we so excited? Our amazing new collection includes a Dire Wolf, two additional bird species, a primate, a pair of cuff links, and, best of all, our very first dinosaur, the beautiful and terrifying Velociraptor!
Clever girl
Fire & Bone pieces take full advantage of exciting new technologies, including 3D scanning and 3D printing, to create something that's not available anywhere else: miniature skulls that are highly detailed and faithful to nature's design.
And, Fire & Bone skulls look beautiful both as pendants or when exhibited as collector's items.
Each skull is cast using traditional techniques, so Fire & Bone is both cutting edge and ancient; a modern twist on a timeless fascination with the animal world, perfect for the modern collector. And when you’re wearing a Fire & Bone piece, you carry the spirit of the animal around with you.
We’ve taken what we learned from our first campaign to add to our collection of skulls and improve them with more detail and scientific accuracy than ever before. We just need your help to put it in motion!
The new collection makes our head spin!
WHAT’S NEW
There are 7 all new skulls, including our first dinosaur, the awesome Velociraptor.
And, a fearsome Dire Wolf (Yes, it was a real animal)!
Nymeria?
We developed a new modeling technique that improves on everything we learned during our first campaign to give the Dire Wolf a beautifully articulated jaw.
In addition to seven new specimens, one of our most popular skulls from our first campaign is now our first fashion accessory: the Gray Wolf cufflinks.
We’ve continued to hone our craft at every level and these new skulls are our best yet. With higher resolution 3D scans, a better 3D printer, and an improved polishing technique, the new skulls are fantastic.
The incredible level of detail is fine enough to let you appreciate the animal’s teeth, horns, cranial structure, and more.
We’ve even acquired better, Made-in-the-US, 24" chains. And for those naturalists who love to exhibit Fire & Bone skulls rather than wear them, we’ve refreshed the design of the species label on the optional wooden display stands. 
THE NEW COLLECTION
And members of any and all wolf packs should note that our Gray Wolf skull is now available as a set of eye-catching cuff links.
Each piece in our second collection is available in solid white or yellow bronze, or sterling silver.
Every piece can be worn on the included chain or exhibited on one of our optional wood display stands. The display stand is made of beautiful walnut stained birch and lacquered for protection. It is optional and not included with every reward tier. 
3D Scanning & Miniaturization
Our process begins by digitally scanning real animal skulls. We work with a company that uses a proprietary 3D scanning process to digitally capture animal skulls in very high detail. We are thrilled with the level of detail we get from this method, which isn't possible with consumer-level 3D scanners.
We scale the piece down to a size suitable for collection or jewelry. Because we do this digitally and not manually, we retain an unprecedented amount of detail from the original skull.
To make the final pieces, we reproduce the miniature model in wax with a professional level high-resolution 3D printer.
With our wax model we make a master mold which allows us to cast the skulls in any metal using traditional lost-wax casting.
We work with a family owned foundry in the U.S. with decades of experience producing large production runs of small delicate pieces.
REWARDS
WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP
The experience of our first Kickstarter project was better than we could have imagined. We accomplished everything we hoped to, including opening a successful online store, selling our skulls in some world renowned Natural History museums and, being able to source rare skulls from extinct animals - but we want to do even more!
Our passionate, amazing backers from the first campaign gave us feedback that we are thrilled to incorporate into the new collection. Things like improving the articulated jaw, better chains, and adding birds and a dinosaur specimen to the Fire & Bone family. Now we want to take it to the next level! Your support allows us to keep building this project and adding amazing specimens and one-of-a-kind accessories to our collection. We are happy that we have not had to compromise our commitment to a beautiful, high quality product. Another campaign lets us expand with the same integrity. We’ll source more highly sought-after skulls, including more dinosaurs and other fossil specimens, and we’ll be able to explore more types of products in addition to pendants and cufflinks.
In particular, we found that gaining access to dinosaur skulls was more difficult and expensive than we had anticipated - one of the most important uses for the funds from this campaign will be to scan more of these delicate and prehistoric specimens. With your help, we’ll be able to make even more amazing things in the future!
Thanks again!
-Jason, Chris, & Matt
(Our thanks to our friends at LAUNCHPACK for their help with this campaign!)

A Story of Ancient China
In ancient China, the Wolf Tower was used mainly to alert soldiers of the danger of encroaching neighbors. Soldiers would burn the excreta of wolves to create a smoke signal atop the tower. Other towers would then be able to spot the smoke signal from afar, and then create their own smoke signal which would pass the message further along to the next tower, and so on.
Smoke is a signal!
In the modern world, people use mobile phones to communicate. We are inundated with social media notifications. At the end of the day, those notifications are just like the smoke signals rising from the top of the Wolf Tower - messages.
Mix your favorite aromatic essential oil in the mist.
Technical Specifications
  Easy to Use
The iScent requires only two steps to set up. First, open up and pair with the iScent App. Next, choose the app that you want to trigger your iScent from the list below. After setup, it isn’t required that the app run in the background, even after rebooting your phone. Just make sure the aromatic water in the tower doesn’t run dry!
Incoming call
text message
Facebook
Gmail
EMail
twitter
Google+
LINE
Skype
Calendar
WeChat
Whatsapp
The iScent App
Party Mode
We understand that you all cool people won’t settle with smelling the ringtone only, so here is the Party Mode! Switch to the party mode, and you will have iScent blow off equalized mist as you speak, sing, or if you want to… scream!
Prototype
In making our prototype, we have employed fused deposition modeling (FDM) to create iScent on a 3D printer. After printing, we install a rough circuit. A bluetooth module is used to control the atomizer and to communicate with an mobile phone. A button switch is used to simulate the Home button, and an amber LED displays the tower’s status.
Our tests have shown that the circuit works perfectly. Everyone on our team has an iScent on their desk, having integrated it into daily life. The practicality and entertainment provided by iScent is enjoyed by everyone. 
Proof of Concept Implementation
Mist Test
A Classic Model
The Wolf Tower may be ancient Chinese history, but we’re keeping old traditions alive in making our model. We have made reference to many castles around the world and chosen one which is both classic and blends in well around the office and at home. We will require our manufacturer to conform with this requirement.
Reference model
Freehand Sketching
REWARDS

iScent Rewards
Current Situation and Timeline
iScent has been in development for a long time now. The software and the rough circuitry have been completed. The next step is to find a local channel by which to produce PCB (Printed Circuit Board) and develop a robust manufacturing infrastructure consisting of world-class craftsmen.
September -- Kickstarter Campaign start

November  -- Manufacturing
December  -- Merry Christmas and worldwide shipping of Kickstarter Rewards

DEFINITION OF BUSINESS PRODUCT AND/OR SERVICES   
The Panther Pizza Box will offer restaurant services whose main product is pizza. However, the menu will be varies with other emphasis on wings, pasta dishes, submarine sandwiches, specialty dessert, and beverages. The Panther Pizza Box is in the process of organizing their state certified LLC, as well as pursuing an available beer license from the State of Ohio. The Panther Pizza Box will provide the area by broadening the food choice compared to those restaurants locally in the town of Delta and the surrounding areas. Additionally, acquisition of a bee license would make The Panther Pizza Box the second pizzeria in the neighboring towns of Swanton and Wauseon to offer beer. The Panther Pizza Box will also offer delivery services to geographic areas extending east to Swanton and west to Wauseon.
MARKETING STRATEGY
The customer base of the Panther Pizza Box will derive from the geographic locations notes above (Swanton to the east, Wauseon to the west). Location of The Panther Pizza Box on Airport Highway (State Rt. 2) will provide an advantage over four of the other six competitors. The Panther Pizza Box will have substantial exposure because of its location on State Rt. 2. The name, The Panther Pizza Box was selected partly in order to assist in taking advantage of this exposure. Marketing studies showed this name to be easily remembered and recalled by anyone who has seen or heard the name. The Delta location is also ideal for timely delivery routes to both Wauseon and Swanton. Both pizza restaurants in Swanton and Wauseon stay within their town limits for delivery which creates a substantial advantage for The Panther Pizza Box. It will be able to serve all three of the aforementioned towns without compromising quality of product or delivery services (which national marketing studies, has been shown to be the primary reason for a consumer to discontinue purchasing product from a specific restaurant/pizzeria. Advertising has long been both a boon and a curse to the pizza industry. Only Marco’s, of the present competition, has truly utilized advertising in a manner that has been shown to increase sales. Two of the remaining four pizza establishments essentially do no marketing while the other two market on a haphazard, inconsistent basis. The Panther Pizza Box intends to attract a youthful to middle aged demographic with designs and images initially drawing them o this location. The Panther Pizza Box will also have an internet site with information designed to create greater exposure and elicit feedback from consumers. This feedback will be utilized in determining direction of further marketing efforts and possible changes in restaurant operations. The company will use a full Point if Sales System (POS). The POS System will allow The Panther Pizza Box to maintain and create information on pizza orders and delivery, product inventory, consumer demographic and financial information. With the exception of Marco’s Pizza, no other restaurant in Northwest Ohio is known to use said technology. Besides providing the above designated information, the system will substantially reduce the time and errors in taking orders and producing the products. It will give an accurate time of pizza arrival to the ordering customer through mapping the time of delivery routes. It will also allow seamless transmission of financial data into reports that will assist in providing direction necessary to administrative decisions. Additionally, it will provide specific information that will provide strong direction in marketing efforts (which, as noted above, have the greatest impact upon sales and profitability). The system will lower costs by increasing efficiency (through decreasing ordering time, speeding product production, improving inventory control and generating financial data) while decreasing possible complaints (associated with incorrect orders/incorrect product charges, poor delivery services and decreasing inefficient services at the site). It is also The Panther Pizza Box’s goal to connect the POS technology to the internet for online ordering therefore, taking advantage of another opportunity which its competitors have essentially ignored. Veteran management, organization in product production and delivery and a customer friendly company image and environment will assist The Panther Pizza Box in separating itself from the competition. The company will also have strength of local appeal. Since the two owners are from the Delta area. This produces a much better appraisal of what the community’s likes and dislikes are about local food service and The Panther Pizza Box specifically. This is a substantial advantage over the major chain restaurant. Small town consumers like to be able to interact with ownership and feel they are a part of their community.
